original: kyi sems rdo rje zhes pa'i sgra bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kyi sems rdo rje zhes pa'i sgra bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the term “vajra of enlightened mind,”

original: byang chub sems ni ji ltar lags //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni ji ltar lags //
translated: what is enlightened mind?

original: zhes pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply,

original: skye 'gag med la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye 'gag med la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: free from arising and ceasing, and so forth.

original: dngos po dngos med mi zad ces pa na mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med mi zad ces pa na mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Since it is free from the two extremes, it is the meaning of “nonabiding nirvāṇa.”

original: gtso zhes pa ni rgyu lta bur kun du khyab pa'o //
analyzed: gtso zhes pa ni rgyu lta bur kun du khyab pa'o //
translated: “Chief” means pervading all like a cause.

original: stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa //
translated: Emptiness and compassion are inseparable.

original: zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings zhes so //
translated: That is the “dharmadhātu.”

original: le'u dang po las rig pa'i skyes bu zhes pa'i sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: le'u dang po las rig pa'i skyes bu zhes pa'i sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In the first chapter, in order to teach the meaning of the term “vidyāpuruṣa,”

original: de bzhin rig pa'i skyes bu ci //
analyzed: de bzhin rig pa'i skyes bu ci //
translated: what is the vidyāpuruṣa?

original: zhes lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes lan gsungs pa /
translated: The reply is given.

original: rang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “One’s own” and so on.

original: mi phyed pa'i zhes pa ni yab yum gnyis rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo nyid gcig pa zhes so //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i zhes pa ni yab yum gnyis rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo nyid gcig pa zhes so //
translated: “Indivisible” means that the father and mother are of one nature, the three vajras.

original: phyed dngos te zhes pa ni de gnyis rnam pa'i kun rdzob kyis phye ba ste /
analyzed: phyed dngos te zhes pa ni de gnyis rnam pa'i kun rdzob kyis phye ba ste /
translated: “Half-substance” means that the two are divided by the conventional aspect.

original: de bas na rig pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu la rig pa'i skyes bu zhes so //
analyzed: de bas na rig pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu la rig pa'i skyes bu zhes so //
translated: Therefore, a person endowed with knowledge is called a “person of knowledge.”

original: le'u dang po'i dbyung ba'i sngags kyi don dri ba'i phyir /
analyzed: le'u dang po'i dbyung ba'i sngags kyi don dri ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to ask about the meaning of the mantra that is to be recited in the first chapter,

original: badzra dhrik ni ji ltar lags //
analyzed: badzra dhrik ni ji ltar lags //
translated: “What is vajradhṛk?”

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i zhus tshig lnga'i lan gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i zhus tshig lnga'i lan gsungs pa ni /
translated: and so on, the reply to the five questions is stated:

original: rgyu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The five causes” and so on.

original: rgyu lnga dang zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: rgyu lnga dang zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five causes are the five, beginning with form.

original: 'bras bu lnga zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu lnga zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five results are the five, beginning with Akṣobhya.

original: de nyid 'og dang gong gi tshul gyis 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'i tshul gyis gzugs ni badzra zhes su bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid 'og dang gong gi tshul gyis 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'i tshul gyis gzugs ni badzra zhes su bstan to //
translated: Just that is taught as “vajra” in the manner of the pure result of the lower and upper.

original: de 'dzin pas na dhrik ces te /
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na dhrik ces te /
translated: Because it holds that, it is dhṛk.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i yid du 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i yid du 'dod do //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is held to be the mind that is pure.

original: yod med dbus las 'das pa las //
analyzed: yod med dbus las 'das pa las //
translated: Beyond existence, nonexistence, and the middle,

original: zhes pa ni yod pa dang med pa dang dbus rnam par rtog pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni yod pa dang med pa dang dbus rnam par rtog pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that conception of existence, nonexistence, and the middle?

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs me long lta bu'i ye shes su rnam par dag pa de sems can thams cad kyi kun gzhi'i rnam pa'i gzugs de la dzi na dzi ka ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs me long lta bu'i ye shes su rnam par dag pa de sems can thams cad kyi kun gzhi'i rnam pa'i gzugs de la dzi na dzi ka ces bya'o //
translated: The form of the elements and the derivative form are pure in the mirror-like wisdom. That is called jinajikā in the form of the alaya of all sentient beings.

original: skye ba zhes pa ni dzi na ste /
analyzed: skye ba zhes pa ni dzi na ste /
translated: Jina means birth.

original: kun brtags kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the imagined nature.

original: de las rgyal bar byed pas dzi ka ces bya ste /
analyzed: de las rgyal bar byed pas dzi ka ces bya ste /
translated: Because it is victorious over that, it is called jikā.

original: rtag pa'i rang bzhin du skye'o zhes so ;🔽/ tshig gi don thams cad mnyam pa nyid las 'byung bas na des dag pa'i sems ni rin po che yin pas na /
analyzed: rtag pa'i rang bzhin du skye'o zhes so ; / tshig gi don thams cad mnyam pa nyid las 'byung bas na des dag pa'i sems ni rin po che yin pas na /
translated: It is born as the nature of permanence.🔽Since all the meanings of the words arise from sameness, the mind that is pure by that is a jewel.

original: thams cad don kun 'byung bas na //
analyzed: thams cad don kun 'byung bas na //
translated: Therefore,

original: sems ni ratnar bstan pa yin //
analyzed: sems ni ratnar bstan pa yin //
translated: the mind is taught to be a jewel.

original: zhes so // de yang tshor ba rnam par dag pa yis nges par tshor bas na de dag pa'i yid ni ratna dhrik ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de yang tshor ba rnam par dag pa yis nges par tshor bas na de dag pa'i yid ni ratna dhrik ces pa'o //
translated: And that is Ratnadhrīk, the mind purified by sensation, since it is definitely sensed.

original: @185b 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa nag po dang ser po la sogs pa mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @185b 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa nag po dang ser po la sogs pa mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of desire is black, yellow, and so on, because it is indicated.

original: des nges par rtogs pa'i ngo bo yong na mtshon pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des nges par rtogs pa'i ngo bo yong na mtshon pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If it is the nature of that which is definitely realized, it is called an indication.

original: des thams cad nas thams cad du gang rol cing yul du byed pas de rnam par dag pa'i yid mtshan ma dang / mtshon pa de yang a'a ro li ka ces bya'o //
analyzed: des thams cad nas thams cad du gang rol cing yul du byed pas de rnam par dag pa'i yid mtshan ma dang / mtshon pa de yang a'a ro li ka ces bya'o //
translated: That which is everywhere and always enjoyed and experienced as an object is the mind purified by that, and that indication is called Ārolik.

original: rnam shes rab tu gsal byed pa //
analyzed: rnam shes rab tu gsal byed pa //
translated: The nature of the aggregate of consciousness is the wisdom of the perfection of wisdom.

original: zhes pa ni sa bon la sogs pa nas nang gi bzlas pa'i las can gyi bar gyis goms pas rnam par shes pa la bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes su gsal ba'i ngo bo de shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa bon la sogs pa nas nang gi bzlas pa'i las can gyi bar gyis goms pas rnam par shes pa la bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes su gsal ba'i ngo bo de shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The nature of consciousness, which is the wisdom of the gnosis of successful activity, is clarified by the practice of the seed syllables and so on up to the inner recitation. That is called wisdom.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pas na dhrik ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pas na dhrik ces bya'o //
translated: Dhrīk is the nature of the purified aggregate of formation, since it holds.

original: da ni le'u dang po las zhe sdang gi rigs mchog la sogs pa'i don zhu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni le'u dang po las zhe sdang gi rigs mchog la sogs pa'i don zhu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to request the meaning of the supreme family of anger and so forth from the first chapter,

original: de bzhin rigs 'dir gang la bgyi //
analyzed: de bzhin rigs 'dir gang la bgyi //
translated: it is said, “What is done in this family?”

original: zhes pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the reply,

original: rigs ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said, “The family is the five tathāgatas,” and so forth.

original: rgyud ni thog ma zhes brjod de //
analyzed: rgyud ni thog ma zhes brjod de //
translated: The tantra is said to be the beginning.

original: zhes pa ni thog ma nas so sor yang rigs su rgyun ma chad ces pa'i don to ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni thog ma nas so sor yang rigs su rgyun ma chad ces pa'i don to ;
translated: This means that from the beginning, the continuum of the individual families is uninterrupted.

original: / mi 'jig ces pa ni rigs lnga'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa la 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: / mi 'jig ces pa ni rigs lnga'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa la 'jig pa med do //
translated: “ Non-destruction” means that the nature of the five families is non-dual and indestructible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skye ba med pa gang yin zhes sku gsung thugs kyi chos thams cad brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma skyes te /
analyzed: skye ba med pa gang yin zhes sku gsung thugs kyi chos thams cad brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ma skyes te /
translated: Because all phenomena of body, speech, and mind are examined by the nature of non-arising, they are unborn.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise in the form of the five tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa'i mgon po yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa'i mgon po yin par brjod do //
translated: the tathāgatas are said to be the lords of infinite space.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa sngags kyi sgo nas bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa sngags kyi sgo nas bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the purity of the tathāgatas through the door of mantra,

original: da ni phung po'i sgo nas rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni phung po'i sgo nas rnam par dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the purity by way of the aggregates is stated.

original: rgyu 'bras zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Cause and effect, etc.

original: de la rgyu la rgyu nyid du zhen pa dang / 'bras bu la 'bras bu nyid du mngon par zhen pa dang gnyis kyi rim pa ste chen po'i zhe sdang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu la rgyu nyid du zhen pa dang / 'bras bu la 'bras bu nyid du mngon par zhen pa dang gnyis kyi rim pa ste chen po'i zhe sdang zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the sequence of the two, the adherence to cause as cause and the manifest adherence to effect as effect, is called great hatred.

original: gnyis po de 'jig par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis po de 'jig par byed pa ni /
translated: The destruction of those two is

original: rnam shes zhe sdang yin par bshad //
analyzed: rnam shes zhe sdang yin par bshad //
translated: explained as the hatred of consciousness.

original: ces te / rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ces te / rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the nature of purity,

original: rgyu 'bras med par chud pa'i ye shes zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras med par chud pa'i ye shes zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is the pristine wisdom that comprehends the absence of cause and effect.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni sems med pas bems pos bcings pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni sems med pas bems pos bcings pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The aggregate of form is the nature of bondage by the insentient because it is without mind.

original: de rnam par dag pa gti mug ces bya ste /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa gti mug ces bya ste /
translated: Its purity is called delusion,

original: thams cad la rang rig cing 'byang pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la rang rig cing 'byang pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and it is called self-knowing and unpurified with respect to everything.

original: tshor ba ni dregs pa dang nga rgyal la sogs pa'i ngo bo bas na de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni bdag tu rlom @186a * //🔽pa'i nga rgyal te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni dregs pa dang nga rgyal la sogs pa'i ngo bo bas na de rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni bdag tu rlom @186a * // pa'i nga rgyal te /
translated: Feeling has the nature of pride, conceit, etc., so its pure nature is the pride of self-conceit.

original: thams cad bdag la mnyam mo snyam pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad bdag la mnyam mo snyam pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: It abides in the characteristic of thinking, “All is equal in me.”

original: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid pas na dngos po la chags pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid pas na dngos po la chags pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya'o //
translated: Perception has the nature of apprehending signs, so it is said to have the characteristic of attachment to things.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni 'dod chags te /
translated: Its purity is desire,

original: thams cad mi gtong ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mi gtong ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: the nature of not forsaking anything.

original: 'du byed ni 'du byed pa'i bdag nyid pas rkyen gyis drangs pa'i bdag nyid can zhes te /
analyzed: 'du byed ni 'du byed pa'i bdag nyid pas rkyen gyis drangs pa'i bdag nyid can zhes te /
translated: Formation has the nature of forming, so it has the nature of being drawn by conditions.

original: bdag kho nas sems can gyi don bya'i gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes nan tan du byed pas na phrag dog ste bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: bdag kho nas sems can gyi don bya'i gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes nan tan du byed pas na phrag dog ste bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: It is envy, the wisdom of purposeful activity, thinking, “I alone will benefit sentient beings, not others.”

original: le'u gnyis pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis kun la khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyis kun la khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the mind of enlightenment pervades all of chapter 2,

original: byang chub ces pa la sogs pa'o //🔽byang chub sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni thams cad mnyam pa'i rang bzhin yin pas srid pa 'byung ba thams cad du zhes te /
analyzed: byang chub ces pa la sogs pa'o // byang chub sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni thams cad mnyam pa'i rang bzhin yin pas srid pa 'byung ba thams cad du zhes te /
translated: The nature of the mind of enlightenment is the nature of the equality of all, and so it is said, in all the occurrences of existence.

original: srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam pa'i rang bzhin zhes so //
analyzed: srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam pa'i rang bzhin zhes so //
translated: The nature of the equality of existence and peace is the nature of the equality of all, and so it is said, in all the occurrences of peace.

original: da ni le'u dang po las /
analyzed: da ni le'u dang po las /
translated: Now, in the first chapter,🔽it is said,

original: 'dod dang thar pa rab bsgrub pa'o //🔽zhes pa las 'dod pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod dang thar pa rab bsgrub pa'o // zhes pa las 'dod pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to accomplish desire and liberation.

original: 'dod chags zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of desire, it is said, desire, and so forth.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: The mind endowed with desire and so forth is desire.

original: dam tshig ni thams cad las mi 'da' ba'i rdo rje 'dzin to //
analyzed: dam tshig ni thams cad las mi 'da' ba'i rdo rje 'dzin to //
translated: Commitment is the vajra holder who does not transgress all.

original: de yang thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du gnas pas na sna tshogs 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de yang thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du gnas pas na sna tshogs 'dra ba'o //
translated: And that is the same as all, and so it is said, like a variety.

original: de yang rang rig pa la mngon par phyogs shing byams pa la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu bas na de dang ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang rig pa la mngon par phyogs shing byams pa la sogs pa goms pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu bas na de dang ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: And that is the result born from the cultivation of love and so forth that is directed toward one's own awareness, and so the mind endowed with that is desire.

original: da ni / mo ha zhes 'dir gang la bgyi //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa zhus tshig lnga'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni / mo ha zhes 'dir gang la bgyi // zhes pa la sogs pa zhus tshig lnga'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: Now, what is to be done here with “moha”?

original: gnyis med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply to the five questions beginning with this is stated with “advaya” and so forth.

original: de yang chos nyid kyi yul can gyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis nga rgyal gyi ngo bo nyid du rmongs pa de la mo ha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chos nyid kyi yul can gyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis nga rgyal gyi ngo bo nyid du rmongs pa de la mo ha zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the nondual intuition whose object is reality is called “moha” in that it is deluded about the very nature of pride.

original: de nyid phyogs nges pa med par phan tshun thug cing 'byer ba'i ngo bos na dve sha'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyogs nges pa med par phan tshun thug cing 'byer ba'i ngo bos na dve sha'o //
translated: That very [pride] is “dveṣa” in that it is mutually impinging and dispersing in nature without any fixed direction.

original: de nyid de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid la zhen cing mi gtong bas na r'a ga'o //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid la zhen cing mi gtong bas na r'a ga'o //
translated: That very [pride] is “rāga” in that it is attached to and does not let go of the character of reality.

original: de nyid mi chod cing mi shigs pa'i ngo bo'i ye shes de ni badzra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi chod cing mi shigs pa'i ngo bo'i ye shes de ni badzra zhes bya'o //
translated: That very [pride] is called “vajra” in that it is the intuition whose nature is indivisible and indestructible.

original: bzhi po de dag gis /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag gis /
translated: Those four

original: ra t'i rdzogs pa'i longs spyod mchog / ces bya ste /
analyzed: ra t'i rdzogs pa'i longs spyod mchog / ces bya ste /
translated: are the “supreme enjoyment of the completion of rati.”

original: gnyis su med pa las rtsa ba'i ye shes kyi dga' ba mtshan ma med pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa las rtsa ba'i ye shes kyi dga' ba mtshan ma med pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the signless joy of the fundamental intuition arises from nonduality.

original: le'u dang po las btsun mo'i mchog phun @186b sum tshogs pa'o zhes pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: le'u dang po las btsun mo'i mchog phun @186b sum tshogs pa'o zhes pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the first chapter, “The Supreme Queen is endowed with perfection,”

original: phun sum tshogs pa ji ltar lags //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa ji ltar lags //
translated: [the Bhagavān] says, “How is perfection?”

original: zhes pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /🔽bud med bde mchog phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir / bud med bde mchog phun sum tshogs //
translated: In order to teach the answer,🔽[the Bhagavān] says, “The supreme bliss of women is perfect.”

original: zhes te / yang dag pa'i bde mchog skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir na phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / yang dag pa'i bde mchog skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir na phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Because she is the cause for generating the supreme bliss of reality, she is perfect.

original: gti mug dga' ma la sogs pa gsum la rdo rje dga' mas zin par bstan pa /
analyzed: gti mug dga' ma la sogs pa gsum la rdo rje dga' mas zin par bstan pa /
translated: The three, beginning with the one who delights in delusion, are taught to be embraced by Vajra-rati.

original: mo ha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mo ha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The Bhagavān] says, “moha” and so forth.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni rdo rje ste /
translated: Vajra is the nature of nondual wisdom.

original: de nas gti mug la sogs pa gsum bsgyur ba ni /
analyzed: de nas gti mug la sogs pa gsum bsgyur ba ni /
translated: Then, the three, beginning with delusion, are transformed.

original: de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi thabs //
translated: That is the method of the buddhas.

original: rdo rje thag pa zhes su bshad //
analyzed: rdo rje thag pa zhes su bshad //
translated: It is explained as the vajra rope.

original: ces pa ni 'di 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽da ni ya m'anta krita don ni gang //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'di 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir ro // da ni ya m'anta krita don ni gang //
translated: Because it causes one to go there.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa zhus tshig bzhi'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa zhus tshig bzhi'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the answer to the four questions beginning with “What is the meaning of Yamāntaka?”🔽[the Bhagavān] says,

original: mi 'jig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Not destroyed” and so forth.

original: lus la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i ngo bos ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid pas na mi 'jig bdag nyid chos te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i ngo bos ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid pas na mi 'jig bdag nyid chos te /
translated: The phenomena of the body and so forth are not destroyed by nature, because they are not produced by the nature of being one or many, and so forth.

original: de nyid dngos po thams cad mi 'da' bas na dam tshig ste /
analyzed: de nyid dngos po thams cad mi 'da' bas na dam tshig ste /
translated: Since that [nature] does not pass beyond all things, it is the commitment.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par dag pa'i yul la dang po'i rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid ya m'anta krita ces so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par dag pa'i yul la dang po'i rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid ya m'anta krita ces so //
translated: In that pure object, the one with the pure nature of the first [stage] is called Yamāntaka.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / ma dad pa dang / gzung ba'i rtog pa ni ya ma'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / ma dad pa dang / gzung ba'i rtog pa ni ya ma'o //
translated: The obscuration of knowledge and lack of faith are Yamā.

original: de nyid med pas na ta krita do //
analyzed: de nyid med pas na ta krita do //
translated: Since they do not exist, they are Takṛt.

original: don dam pa'i 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid chos thams cad dag par byed pa nyid pas na rnam shes min bdag ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid chos thams cad dag par byed pa nyid pas na rnam shes min bdag ste /
translated: The nature of the ultimate transformation is the agent of purifying all phenomena, and so is the nature of non-consciousness.

original: byang chub kyi bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the nature of grasping enlightenment.

original: de lta bu sems kun gyi dam tshig ste /
analyzed: de lta bu sems kun gyi dam tshig ste /
translated: That is the commitment of all minds.

original: de'i tshul gyis pra dzny'anta krita ces te /
analyzed: de'i tshul gyis pra dzny'anta krita ces te /
translated: By that method, it is Prajñāntaka.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi byed pa'i phyir dad pa dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus kyis skyon kho na med par byed pas na ta krita do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi byed pa'i phyir dad pa dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus kyis skyon kho na med par byed pas na ta krita do //
translated: Since one engages in the four correct abandonments, one makes effort with faith, and since one makes effort to eliminate faults alone, one is Takkirita.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo'i ngo bo med pas na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo'i ngo bo med pas na /
translated: Since the nature of all phenomena is not the entity of the mind, such as name and form,

original: brjod med bdag nyid chos rnams ni //
analyzed: brjod med bdag nyid chos rnams ni //
translated: they are “inexpressible.”

original: zhes bya'o // de lta bu de chos thams cad kyi dam tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de lta bu de chos thams cad kyi dam tshig ste /
translated: That is the pledge of all phenomena.

original: des na padmanta krita ces so //
analyzed: des na padmanta krita ces so //
translated: Therefore, one is Padmantakrita.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brjod du med pa'i yul la 'dun pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa la brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems ma 'khrugs pa'i dran pa thob pa ni padma'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i yul la 'dun pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa la brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems ma 'khrugs pa'i dran pa thob pa ni padma'o //
translated: The yogi/nī who is endowed with effort in the aspect of aspiration, etc., for the inexpressible object, attains mindfulness that is not disturbed, which is the lotus.

original: de nyid skyon rnams med par byed pas na ta krita do //🔽phung po la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams ni 'dzin pa @187a * //
analyzed: de nyid skyon rnams med par byed pas na ta krita do // phung po la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams ni 'dzin pa @187a * //
translated: Since that eliminates faults, one is Takkirita.

original: la sogs pas rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid yin pas /
analyzed: la sogs pas rang bzhin gyis zhi ba nyid yin pas /
translated: The aggregates, etc., are naturally peaceful by the nature of grasping, etc.

original: mi rtog bdag nyid rnams ni zhi //
analyzed: mi rtog bdag nyid rnams ni zhi //
translated: The nature of non-conceptuality is peace.

original: zhes bya'o // de nyid rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nyid rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ste /
translated: That itself is the vajra, the commitment of all the Tathagatas.

original: tshul des na bighn'anta krita ces so //
analyzed: tshul des na bighn'anta krita ces so //
translated: By that method, he is called Vighnantakṛt.

original: mi rtog pa'i chos la dran pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu gang yin pa de la bighn'anta krita ces ma dad pa la sogs pa'i bgegs med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtog pa'i chos la dran pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu gang yin pa de la bighn'anta krita ces ma dad pa la sogs pa'i bgegs med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The yogi who is endowed with mindfulness of the dharma of non-conceptuality, the cause of the samādhi of one-pointed mind and right wisdom, is called Vighnantakṛt, because he makes the obstacles of lack of faith and so on cease.

original: da ni don de rnams sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi ngo bo yin pas de shes na bde ba chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bzhi char gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni don de rnams sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi ngo bo yin pas de shes na bde ba chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bzhi char gyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to summarize the conclusion of all four [mantras], [the Bhagavān] says, “This is the essence of the enlightenment of the Buddhas. If one knows it, one attains great bliss.”

original: mi 'jig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [He says,] “indestructible,” and so on.

original: da ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rang gi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rang gi bya ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to teach the activity of Yamāntaka and so on from the perspective of the purity of the afflictions, [the Bhagavān] says,🔽“The wrathful one,” and so on.

original: gti mug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Delusion, etc.

original: de la gti mug ni gong du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la gti mug ni gong du bstan pa'o //
translated: Therein, delusion is as previously explained.

original: des longs spyod par gyur pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: des longs spyod par gyur pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: The one who has become the enjoyer is Vairocana.

original: de goms pa las skyes te /
analyzed: de goms pa las skyes te /
translated: He is born from the cultivation of that.

original: de dag mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin la longs spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin la longs spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The enjoyment of those is called the nature of non-division.

original: gti mug zad phyir zhes pa ni //
analyzed: gti mug zad phyir zhes pa ni //
translated: Because of the exhaustion of delusion, etc.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi shes pa'i gti mug rab tu 'jug pa zad par byed pa'i sgo'i bdag por gyur pa'i phyir gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi shes pa'i gti mug rab tu 'jug pa zad par byed pa'i sgo'i bdag por gyur pa'i phyir gshin rje gshed do //
translated: Because of becoming the lord of the door of exhaustion of the engagement of the delusion of non-knowledge, which is the discordant class of that, he is Yamântaka.

original: de nyid kyis na lus mthar byed ces te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na lus mthar byed ces te /
translated: For that very reason, he is the one who brings the body to an end.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba med pa'i phyir zhes so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba med pa'i phyir zhes so //
translated: Because of the absence of the view of the transitory collection, etc.

original: gzung ba spangs pa nyid kyis na shes bya mthar byed 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: gzung ba spangs pa nyid kyis na shes bya mthar byed 'gyur zhes so //
translated: Because of the abandonment of the apprehended, he becomes the one who brings the object of knowledge to an end.

original: gzhan rnams la yang tshig thabs de bsgre bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la yang tshig thabs de bsgre bar bya'o //
translated: The method of words should be extended to the others as well.

original: sems ni mthar byed de zhes pa ni 'dzin pa'i rtog pa'i sems ni sems te de med par byed do zhes so //
analyzed: sems ni mthar byed de zhes pa ni 'dzin pa'i rtog pa'i sems ni sems te de med par byed do zhes so //
translated: The mind is brought to an end. The mind is the mind that is the conception of the apprehender, and he brings that to an end.

original: de med pas na nyon mongs mthar byed 'gyur zhes te //
analyzed: de med pas na nyon mongs mthar byed 'gyur zhes te //
translated: Since that does not exist, it becomes the terminator of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid sngon du 'gro bas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid sngon du 'gro bas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Afflictions are so called because they precede the nature of grasping.

original: dag mthar byed ces pa ni tshig gi ngo bo 'gog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dag mthar byed ces pa ni tshig gi ngo bo 'gog par byed pa ste /
translated: The terminator of purity is the cessation of the nature of words.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: snyoms 'jug ces te ;
analyzed: snyoms 'jug ces te ;
translated: It is meditative equipoise.

original: tshig dang tshig bya gnyig mnyam pa ni snyoms 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshig dang tshig bya gnyig mnyam pa ni snyoms 'jug ste /
translated: The equality of both word and action is meditative equipoise.

original: ngag gi ngo bo 'gog pas de med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi ngo bo 'gog pas de med par byed pa'o //
translated: Since that is the cessation of the nature of speech, it is the terminator of that.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa'i las kyi sgrib pa kun zad par byed pa'i ye shes des skyon gsum 'joms par @187b byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa'i las kyi sgrib pa kun zad par byed pa'i ye shes des skyon gsum 'joms par @187b byed ces bya'o //
translated: The pristine consciousness that completely eliminates all the obscurations of karma, such as the five heinous actions, and so on, is called the destroyer of the three faults.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is because of the afflictions, and so on.

original: de nyon mongs pa nyid mi shigs pas rdo rje ste de nyid sgrib pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa nyid mi shigs pas rdo rje ste de nyid sgrib pa yin la /
translated: Since the afflictions themselves are indestructible, they are vajras.

original: de rnam par dag pa gnyis su med par shes na /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa gnyis su med par shes na /
translated: If one understands that nondual purity,

original: las rnams thams cad rnam par dag / ces so //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad rnam par dag / ces so //
translated: All actions are pure.

original: de dag pas na las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu yang rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes te /
analyzed: de dag pas na las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu yang rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes te /
translated: And because of that, the result born from action is also pure.

original: mtho ris dang ngan song yang rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: mtho ris dang ngan song yang rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Thus, the higher realms and the lower realms are also pure.

original: byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: They become the cause of enlightenment.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang la sdig dang bsod nams med //
analyzed: gang la sdig dang bsod nams med //
translated: Where there is no sin and no merit,

original: de la byang chub yin par gsungs //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la byang chub yin par gsungs // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There enlightenment is taught.

original: khro bo rnams kyi skabs bshad pa yin pas na zhus pa med na yang rang bzhin du gtogs pa'i chos rnam par dag pa kho na gsungs pa /
analyzed: khro bo rnams kyi skabs bshad pa yin pas na zhus pa med na yang rang bzhin du gtogs pa'i chos rnam par dag pa kho na gsungs pa /
translated: Since this is the explanation of the occasion of the wrathful ones, even though there is no question, the intrinsic nature of the pure phenomena is taught:🔽The purity of the apprehended, the apprehender,

original: gzung dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the word, the action, and the obscurations.

original: de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / tshig dang tshig bya ba dang / sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de'i rnam pa so sor shes pa de la gzung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / tshig dang tshig bya ba dang / sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de'i rnam pa so sor shes pa de la gzung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The intrinsic nature of the purity of the apprehended, the apprehender, the word, the action, and the obscurations is the individual cognition of those aspects. That is called the apprehended.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: It is the king of desires.

original: chags pa ni de la dga' ba ste dbyug pa sngon po'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni de la dga' ba ste dbyug pa sngon po'o //
translated: Attachment is the delight in that, which is Nīladaṇḍa.

original: rnam pa ni 'dra bar skyed pa ste stobs po che'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'dra bar skyed pa ste stobs po che'o //
translated: Aspect is the generation of similarity, which is Mahābala.

original: mi g-yo ba ni de kho na nyid la brtan pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa ste mi g-yo mgon po'o //🔽rgyu nyid ni de nyid goms pa las nus pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni de kho na nyid la brtan pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa ste mi g-yo mgon po'o // rgyu nyid ni de nyid goms pa las nus pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Immovability is the abiding in the nature of firmness in reality, which is Acalanātha.

original: gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: Causality is the possession of ability from the cultivation of that itself, which is Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin.

original: 'bras bu nyid ni de nyid la goms pa la gsal bar 'gyur ba ste gnod mdzes so //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni de nyid la goms pa la gsal bar 'gyur ba ste gnod mdzes so //
translated: Fruition is the clarity that arises from the cultivation of that itself, which is Sumbha.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs drug / khro bo'i dbang po rnam par grags //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs drug / khro bo'i dbang po rnam par grags //
translated: the six beginning with Kāmarāja are renowned as the lords of wrath.

original: zhes te / rgyu'i sde med pa'i phyir ri mo dang / 'byin pa dang / lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: zhes te / rgyu'i sde med pa'i phyir ri mo dang / 'byin pa dang / lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha ma yin zhes so //
translated: Since there is no class of causes, they are not deities of the maṇḍala of the painting, the emanation, and the body.

original: ma zhus kyang gleng gzhi la gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ming la sogs pa la som nyi dgag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ma zhus kyang gleng gzhi la gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ming la sogs pa la som nyi dgag pa'i phyir //
translated: Even though not asked, in order to stop doubt about the names, etc., of the bodhisattvas included in the nidāna,

original: dam tshig rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six beginning with the pledge vajra are renowned as the pure elements of the pure forms.

original: dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa drug ni gzugs dang ba rnams rnam par dag pa 'byung ba las gyur par grags so //
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa drug ni gzugs dang ba rnams rnam par dag pa 'byung ba las gyur par grags so //
translated: The six beginning with the pledge vajra are renowned as the pure elements of the pure forms.

original: mig la sogs pas thams cad mkhyen par bsgrub pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyud las rig pa'i rgyal po zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas thams cad mkhyen par bsgrub pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyud las rig pa'i rgyal po zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: The root tantra also explains the king of awarenesses because the eyes and so on are established as omniscience.

original: de bzhin du sa rdo rje la sogs pa lnga ni 'byung ba rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du grags so zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa rdo rje la sogs pa lnga ni 'byung ba rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du grags so zhes so //
translated: Similarly, the five beginning with earth vajra are renowned as the nature of the pure elements.

original: de rnams la rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de rnams la rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: The root tantra states:

original: rdo rje bdag @188a * //🔽po zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bdag @188a * // po zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The vajra lord.

original: de rtogs pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pas de skad do //
analyzed: de rtogs pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pas de skad do //
translated: It is so called because by realizing that, one attains nirvana.

original: de bas na 'di rnams kyi rtog pas gleng gzhi la sdud pa pos rnam par bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di rnams kyi rtog pas gleng gzhi la sdud pa pos rnam par bkod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the compiler arranged the nidana with the concepts of these.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams yi ge gsum gyis 'byung bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams yi ge gsum gyis 'byung bar gsungs pa /
translated: The goddesses of form and so on are said to arise from the three syllables.

original: sku gsung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind vajras.

original: de bas na rgyu'i sde med pa'i phyir dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa yang ri mo dang / 'byin pa dang / lus kyi lha ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu'i sde med pa'i phyir dam tshig rdo rje la sogs pa yang ri mo dang / 'byin pa dang / lus kyi lha ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there is no class of causes, the pledge vajra and so forth are not the painted, the emitted, or the body deities.

original: da ni le'u lnga pa las thams cad la spyod pa ni kun du spyod pa'o zhes pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni le'u lnga pa las thams cad la spyod pa ni kun du spyod pa'o zhes pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning of “the conduct in all ways” in chapter five,

original: mgon po kun du spyod pa ci //
analyzed: mgon po kun du spyod pa ci //
translated: it says, “What is the conduct of the protector?”

original: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The reply is given:

original: thabs dang shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Means and wisdom,” and so forth.

original: de ji skad du bshad pa'i thabs dang shes rab las byung zhing dkyil 'khor ba'i rnam par phung po la sogs pa thams cad dag par mos pas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba sngags pas nges par byas la /
analyzed: de ji skad du bshad pa'i thabs dang shes rab las byung zhing dkyil 'khor ba'i rnam par phung po la sogs pa thams cad dag par mos pas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba sngags pas nges par byas la /
translated: The mantra practitioner should ascertain that all the aggregates and so forth, which arise from the means and wisdom as explained, are the pure maṇḍala deities through devotion.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad bral zhing mi 'gyur bar dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis seng ge bzhin du rgyu zhing gnas so zhes so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad bral zhing mi 'gyur bar dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis seng ge bzhin du rgyu zhing gnas so zhes so //
translated: With a mind free from all fear and doubt of impermanence, one should move about and remain like a lion.

original: de ltar gnas pa la spyod pa thams cad spyad par bstan pa /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa la spyod pa thams cad spyad par bstan pa /
translated: It is taught that one who remains in that way should engage in all conduct.

original: 'di la mi bya ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di la mi bya ci yang med //
translated: There is nothing that is not to be done here.

original: ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de bas na /🔽mnyam par ma bzhag sbyor ba yis ;
analyzed: de bas na / mnyam par ma bzhag sbyor ba yis ;
translated: Therefore,

original: / zhes te /
analyzed: / zhes te /
translated: Through the application of non-equipoise,

original: smyon pa la sogs pa'i tshul du sbyor yang sems rtag pa nyid mnyam par 'jog pas na sems la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: smyon pa la sogs pa'i tshul du sbyor yang sems rtag pa nyid mnyam par 'jog pas na sems la spyod pa ste /
translated: Even though one applies oneself in the manner of a madman and so on, the mind is always in equipoise. Therefore, it is the conduct of the mind.

original: de kun nas spyod pas na de skad do //
analyzed: de kun nas spyod pas na de skad do //
translated: Since one completely engages in that, it is so called.

original: le'u bdun pa las sngags kyi spyod pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: le'u bdun pa las sngags kyi spyod pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of mantra conduct in the seventh chapter,🔽it is asked,

original: de bzhin sngags kyi spyod pa ci //
analyzed: de bzhin sngags kyi spyod pa ci //
translated: What is the conduct of mantra?

original: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The reply is given:

original: rkyen las byung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen las byung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Arisen from conditions, and so on.

original: dbang po dang yul la brten nas rnam par shes pa gang 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni yid kyi sgrar bshad la /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul la brten nas rnam par shes pa gang 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni yid kyi sgrar bshad la /
translated: Whatever consciousness arises in dependence on the sense organ and the object is explained to be the sound of mind.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa las 'khor ba las skyob pas na mantra ste sngags so //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa las 'khor ba las skyob pas na mantra ste sngags so //
translated: Since that very pure mind protects from samsara, it is mantra.

original: des 'jig rten gyi spyod pa las rnam par grol ba'i dam tshig dang sdom pa rdo rje thams cad kyis bskyangs pa'i ngo bo srung ba de sngags kyi spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des 'jig rten gyi spyod pa las rnam par grol ba'i dam tshig dang sdom pa rdo rje thams cad kyis bskyangs pa'i ngo bo srung ba de sngags kyi spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is the mantra conduct, which is the essence of the protection of all the vajras of the commitments and vows that are liberated from worldly conduct.

original: le'u gsum pa las bzlas brjod bstan pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: le'u gsum pa las bzlas brjod bstan pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the teaching of the recitation in the third chapter,

original: rang rang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang rang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “each one” and so forth.

original: de yang sku rdo rje la sogs pa rang rang gi ngo bo @188b rnams yid kyis rnam par bsams te zhes so //
analyzed: de yang sku rdo rje la sogs pa rang rang gi ngo bo @188b rnams yid kyis rnam par bsams te zhes so //
translated: Moreover, having mentally contemplated the essences of each one, such as the Body Vajra, and so forth,

original: des na / gsang sngags zlos pa'i dbye ba yis //🔽zhes te / rim pa'am /
analyzed: des na / gsang sngags zlos pa'i dbye ba yis // zhes te / rim pa'am /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “the divisions of the mantra reciter,”🔽that is, the divisions of the reciter of the mantra, either sequentially or

original: cig car gyi dbye bas sngags zlos par byed cing spro ba dang bsdu bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: cig car gyi dbye bas sngags zlos par byed cing spro ba dang bsdu bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: simultaneously, should emanate and gather.

original: de ltar rdo rje gsum gyi bzlas pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje gsum gyi bzlas pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the recitation of the three vajras,

original: da ni ye shes sems dpa'i bzlas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni ye shes sems dpa'i bzlas pa gsungs pa /
translated: now, the recitation of the gnosis being is stated:

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The buddhas” and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas sna tshogs zhes pa ni rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor rnams dus gcig kho nar ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon las spro zhing bsdu zhes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sna tshogs zhes pa ni rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor rnams dus gcig kho nar ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon las spro zhing bsdu zhes so //
translated: The Buddha Vairocana is the seed of the five families, and the seed of the five families is the seed of the five gnoses.

original: de nas ci zhe na /
analyzed: de nas ci zhe na /
translated: Then what?

original: byang chub bdag med de /
analyzed: byang chub bdag med de /
translated: Enlightenment is selflessness.

original: gzung 'dzin dang bral bas na de skad do //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin dang bral bas na de skad do //
translated: It is so called because it is free from subject and object.

original: brtul zhugs kyi de bzhin nyid yin pas bdag med pa'i sa bon la gzung zhes te /
analyzed: brtul zhugs kyi de bzhin nyid yin pas bdag med pa'i sa bon la gzung zhes te /
translated: Since it is the reality of the observances, it is the seed of selflessness, which is to be held,

original: gnas brtan par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gnas brtan par bya'o zhes so //
translated: and is to be made firm.

original: de nas yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: de nas yang ci zhe na /
translated: Then what?

original: sna tshogs bzhin du zhes te /
analyzed: sna tshogs bzhin du zhes te /
translated: Like a variety,

original: rang nyid dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du mos nas zhes so //
analyzed: rang nyid dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid du mos nas zhes so //
translated: one should imagine oneself as the nature of all things.

original: sna tshogs spro zhes pa ni rigs lnga la sogs pa spro ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs spro zhes pa ni rigs lnga la sogs pa spro ba ste /
translated: The variety is the emanation of the five families, and so forth.

original: de yang dus gsum ni rdo rje yi ge gsum gyi bar du bcug pa'i sa bon dag gis bzlas zhes so //🔽de bas na bzlas pa ni smra ba yin la /
analyzed: de yang dus gsum ni rdo rje yi ge gsum gyi bar du bcug pa'i sa bon dag gis bzlas zhes so // de bas na bzlas pa ni smra ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, the three times are the repetition with the seeds that are inserted between the three vajra syllables.🔽Therefore, repetition is speech.

original: smra ba ni ngag gi bzlas pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: smra ba ni ngag gi bzlas pa zhes bya la /
translated: Speech is called the repetition of speech.

original: de nyid 'bod pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid 'bod pa yin la /
translated: That is the invocation.

original: 'bod pa nyid de kho na la bskul bar smra bas na rnal 'byor pas kyang //🔽sku mchog rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: 'bod pa nyid de kho na la bskul bar smra bas na rnal 'byor pas kyang // sku mchog rdo rje rdzogs byang chub //
translated: And since the invocation is said to be the urging of reality itself, the yogī should also

original: ces pa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid kyis bskul bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid kyis bskul bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: urge with reality, as in “the supreme body, the vajra, is the enlightenment.”

original: dam tshig sems dpa' dang 'dra bar ye shes sems dpa' bskyed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' dang 'dra bar ye shes sems dpa' bskyed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach that the wisdom being is generated in the same way as the commitment being,

original: ji ltar snying gar byin gyis rlob pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang de bzhin no //🔽spro ba'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa de rnams kyi bdag kho na bzhin du bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang ldan par bstan pa /
analyzed: ji ltar snying gar byin gyis rlob pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang de bzhin no // spro ba'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa de rnams kyi bdag kho na bzhin du bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang ldan par bstan pa /
translated: the samādhi of the consecration at the heart is also like that.

original: de rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four branches of familiarization and attainment are taught to be the same for those emanated buddhas and so on as they are for oneself.

original: spro ba de rnams kyang spyi bor dbang bskur nas gong ma bzhin du mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: spro ba de rnams kyang spyi bor dbang bskur nas gong ma bzhin du mchod par bya'o //
translated: The emanations are also consecrated at the crown, and they are offered to as before.

original: de yang rdo rje 'chang bzhin du rig pa dang lhan cig tu yod pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rdo rje 'chang bzhin du rig pa dang lhan cig tu yod pa ste /
translated: Moreover, they exist together with the awareness, like Vajradhara.

original: de'i longs spyod bzhir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i longs spyod bzhir shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that as the four enjoyments.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: bdag byin brlabs zhes te /
analyzed: bdag byin brlabs zhes te /
translated: “Self-consecration”

original: chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis brlabs //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis brlabs //
translated: is consecrated in the realm of phenomena.

original: zhes te smos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te smos pa'o //
translated: That is stated.

original: sogs kyi sgras ni lhag ma gnyis bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras ni lhag ma gnyis bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the remaining two.

original: de bas na thams cad kyi spros pa yang @189a * //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad kyi spros pa yang @189a * //
translated: Therefore, all elaborations

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: should be known as the lord of the maṇḍala.

original: da ni le'u bco lnga pa'i rgyas 'debs pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni le'u bco lnga pa'i rgyas 'debs pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the meaning of the seal of the fifteenth chapter,

original: rgyas 'debs ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi //🔽zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyas 'debs ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi // zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: [the Bhagavān] says, “How should one know the seal?”

original: dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply is [given] by “the hero” and so forth.

original: dpa' bo zhes ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / khro bo rnams so zhes so //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / khro bo rnams so zhes so //
translated: “Hero” refers to the bodhisattvas and wrathful ones.

original: rdo rje rnams zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //🔽de rnams kyi spyi bor dbang bskur re re ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rnams zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so // de rnams kyi spyi bor dbang bskur re re ste /
translated: “Vajras” refers to the tathāgatas.

original: zhes pa ni rang rang gi rigs kyi bdag po rig ma dang ldan pa re re ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang rang gi rigs kyi bdag po rig ma dang ldan pa re re ste /
translated: “Each of them” refers to each of the lords of their respective families, together with their knowledge consorts.

original: rigs lnga ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: rigs lnga ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: It does not refer to the five families.

original: de 'ba' zhig gis rgyas gdab ce na /
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig gis rgyas gdab ce na /
translated: If it is asked by whom is it sealed, it is sealed by the sole

original: snying po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: vajra.

original: de la snying po dang phyag rgya dang sngags ni phyag rgya bzhi ste /🔽de ltar thams cad kyi rigs kyi rim pas rgyas gdab ces so //🔽rgyu rdo rje 'chang ba la 'bras bu mi bskyod pas rgyas gdab ces te bzlog go //
analyzed: de la snying po dang phyag rgya dang sngags ni phyag rgya bzhi ste / de ltar thams cad kyi rigs kyi rim pas rgyas gdab ces so // rgyu rdo rje 'chang ba la 'bras bu mi bskyod pas rgyas gdab ces te bzlog go //
translated: The essence, the mudra, and the mantra are the four mudras.

original: le'u gsum pa la sogs pa'o //🔽nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas par //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /🔽chos 'byung ba ni ji ltar bsgom //
analyzed: le'u gsum pa la sogs pa'o // nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas par // zhes pa la sogs pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir / chos 'byung ba ni ji ltar bsgom //
translated: Thus, it is said that all are sealed by the stages of the family.

original: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /🔽longs spyod bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de yang gtso bo'i nges pa gnas gyur pa la bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i longs spyod bzhi dang ldan pa'i rig ma'i skyes bu rdo rje can du gyur nas /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /🔽longs spyod bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de yang gtso bo'i nges pa gnas gyur pa la bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i longs spyod bzhi dang ldan pa'i rig ma'i skyes bu rdo rje can du gyur nas /
translated: The cause is sealed by the result.

original: de gnas gyur pas sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gru gsum du rnam par bsgom zhes so //
analyzed: de gnas gyur pas sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gru gsum du rnam par bsgom zhes so //
translated: By transforming that, one should meditate on the nature of the body, etc., as a triangle.

original: gzhi gang la bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi gang la bsgom zhe na /
translated: On what basis should one meditate?

original: kun nas ser po'i 'khor lo ni //
analyzed: kun nas ser po'i 'khor lo ni //
translated: The wheel is completely yellow,

original: rtsibs bcu ste bcu rtag par bsgom zhes te /
analyzed: rtsibs bcu ste bcu rtag par bsgom zhes te /
translated: with ten spokes, always meditated as ten.

original: sa bcu rnam par dag pa'i 'khor lo ser po rtsibs bcu pa rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: sa bcu rnam par dag pa'i 'khor lo ser po rtsibs bcu pa rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: Having meditated on the yellow wheel of the ten pure stages with ten spokes,

original: de'i dbus su sgo nga la brten pa zhes so //
analyzed: de'i dbus su sgo nga la brten pa zhes so //
translated: in the middle of that, one should meditate on the one who is based on the egg.

original: rtsibs rnams la khro bo bcu bsgom ste /
analyzed: rtsibs rnams la khro bo bcu bsgom ste /
translated: One should meditate on the ten wrathful ones on the spokes.

original: de yang dad pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pas //
analyzed: de yang dad pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam par dag pas //
translated: Moreover, by the purity of the consciousnesses of faith, etc.,

original: bdag nyid ye shes bcu las 'byung //
analyzed: bdag nyid ye shes bcu las 'byung //
translated: one’s own nature arises from the ten awarenesses.

original: zhes so// 'gog pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ni rtse gcig pa mang po 'phros pas zhes so //
analyzed: zhes so// 'gog pa'i rdo rje zhes pa ni rtse gcig pa mang po 'phros pas zhes so //
translated: The “vajra of cessation” is the many single-pointed emanations.

original: de bas na sems mchog tu mdzes pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sems mchog tu mdzes pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should practice with the most beautiful mind.

original: 'khor lo de yang gzhi rdo rjer skad cig gis g-yon du 'khor bar byed pas mi 'gul ba 'dra bas na //
analyzed: 'khor lo de yang gzhi rdo rjer skad cig gis g-yon du 'khor bar byed pas mi 'gul ba 'dra bas na //
translated: Moreover, that wheel is turned to the left in an instant on the basis of the vajra, as if unmoving.

original: mi g-yo ba dang mtshungs par 'khor //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang mtshungs par 'khor //
translated: One should know that the four are the same as the immovables.

original: zhes so // @189b chos 'byung ba'i rang bzhin dang yon tan gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // @189b chos 'byung ba'i rang bzhin dang yon tan gsungs pa /
translated: The nature and qualities of the source of phenomena are taught.

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: As such, etc.

original: le'u bcu bdun pa la sogs pa'i sdom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun pa la sogs pa'i sdom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of the seventeenth chapter, etc.,

original: de bzhin sdom pa ji lta bu //
analyzed: de bzhin sdom pa ji lta bu //
translated: How is the vow like that?

original: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The answer is given:

original: rdo rje can zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra holder, etc.

original: sgrub pa zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi sgrub pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi sgrub pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: Practice is the cause of the practice of the two stages.

original: nan tan ni rjes su blangs pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan ni rjes su blangs pa'o //
translated: Application is taking it up.

original: dam tshig ni bsrung ba dang / bza' ba dang / spang ba'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni bsrung ba dang / bza' ba dang / spang ba'o //
translated: Vow is that which is to be guarded, eaten, and abandoned.

original: de thams cad rtsa ba'i rgyud du gsungs so //
analyzed: de thams cad rtsa ba'i rgyud du gsungs so //
translated: All of that is taught in the Root Tantra.

original: sdom pa yang der gsungs so //
analyzed: sdom pa yang der gsungs so //
translated: The vow is also taught there.

original: de nyid yin yang //
analyzed: de nyid yin yang //
translated: Although that is so,

original: rim pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin //
analyzed: rim pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin //
translated: it is distinguished by the division of the stages.

original: zhes te / khyad par du gsungs so zhes te /
analyzed: zhes te / khyad par du gsungs so zhes te /
translated: It is taught in particular.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is taught:

original: gzugs dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Form, etc.

original: de yang gzugs la sogs pa re re la yang bde ba la sogs pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug sogs rtag tu snying la skye bar 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: de yang gzugs la sogs pa re re la yang bde ba la sogs pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug sogs rtag tu snying la skye bar 'gyur zhes so //
translated: Moreover, with regard to each of form and so on, attachment, aversion, delusion, and so on, arise constantly in the heart.

original: de nyid sdom pas /
analyzed: de nyid sdom pas /
translated: The same is summarized:

original: chags la 'dod chags rdo rje can //
analyzed: chags la 'dod chags rdo rje can //
translated: In attachment, the vajra of attachment.

original: zhes te / 'dod chags byung ma thag tu tshe dpag med du bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes te / 'dod chags byung ma thag tu tshe dpag med du bsam mo //
translated: As soon as attachment arises, one should imagine it as Amitayus.

original: rdo rje dra ba rin chen 'byung //
analyzed: rdo rje dra ba rin chen 'byung //
translated: The vajra net is the source of jewels.

original: zhes pa ni zhe sdang byung ma thag rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhe sdang byung ma thag rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: As soon as aversion arises, it is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of their equality.

original: de bzhin du gti mug la dam tshig ces rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gti mug la dam tshig ces rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, delusion is the commitment, because one does not go beyond the nature of Vairocana.

original: 'dod pa de rnams dam tshig mtshungs //
analyzed: 'dod pa de rnams dam tshig mtshungs //
translated: Those desires are equal commitments.

original: zhes pa ni de thams cad kyang rdo rje 'chang chen por blta ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de thams cad kyang rdo rje 'chang chen por blta ste /
translated: One should see all of them as Mahāvajradhara.

original: de ltar gnyis su med pas gzugs la sogs pa bsten pa ni sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis su med pas gzugs la sogs pa bsten pa ni sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the reliance on form and so on, because of their nonduality, is called the commitment.

original: da ni le'u dgu pa'i lus kyi las rnam par dag pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni le'u dgu pa'i lus kyi las rnam par dag pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning of the purity of physical action in the ninth chapter,

original: zhe sdang gti mug ces pa la sogs pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhe sdang gti mug ces pa la sogs pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the reply beginning with “hatred, delusion,”🔽and so forth.

original: brkam pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brkam pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Greed, and so forth” and so forth.

original: rnam bcas dang ni zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab tu snang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam bcas dang ni zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab tu snang ba'o //
translated: “ With aspects” is the appearance as method and wisdom.

original: rnam pa med ces pa ni don dam par gnyis su med par bsams nas /
analyzed: rnam pa med ces pa ni don dam par gnyis su med par bsams nas /
translated: “ Without aspects” is the ultimate non-duality.

original: kun 'gro yi ge gsum bdag ces pa ni kun gyi rang bzhin yi ge gsum gyis rgyas btab nas /
analyzed: kun 'gro yi ge gsum bdag ces pa ni kun gyi rang bzhin yi ge gsum gyis rgyas btab nas /
translated: “ The three syllables, which are all-pervading, are my own” is the sealing with the three syllables, the nature of all.

original: bya ba dang zhes pa gnod byed gsod pa dang / dbrog pa zhes pa ser sna can gyi nor dbrog pa la sogs pa yang spro ba dang / rang gi bzlas pas bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: bya ba dang zhes pa gnod byed gsod pa dang / dbrog pa zhes pa ser sna can gyi nor dbrog pa la sogs pa yang spro ba dang / rang gi bzlas pas bya'o zhes so //
translated: “ Activity” is the delight in killing the harm-doer, and “stealing” is the delight in stealing the wealth of the miser, and so forth.

original: de ltar zhe sdang la sogs pa las dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs gsum du bskyed par bya @190a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhe sdang la sogs pa las dang rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs gsum du bskyed par bya @190a * //
translated: Thus, one should generate the three forms in accordance with the karma of hatred and so forth.

original: ste ; sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba dag pas rgyas gdab par bya zhing dbyer med pa can gyis ji ltar 'dod pa'i don byed do zhes so //
analyzed: ste ; sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba dag pas rgyas gdab par bya zhing dbyer med pa can gyis ji ltar 'dod pa'i don byed do zhes so //
