analyzed: bsnyen pa'i cho ga zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The ritual of approach and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i yan lag dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i yan lag dang / sku gsum thob pa'i yan lag dang / khams gsum chos kyi rgyal por dbang thob pa'i yan lag bzhi'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i yan lag dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i yan lag dang / sku gsum thob pa'i yan lag dang / khams gsum chos kyi rgyal por dbang thob pa'i yan lag bzhi'o //
translated: The four branches of the attainment of the result are the branch of the attainment of the result of the four bodies, the branch of the attainment of the result of the four activities, the branch of the attainment of the result of the four types of control, and the branch of the attainment of the result of the four types of fearlessness.

original: bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the divisions of the approach and so on,

original: thun mong zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said, “common and supreme.”

original: thun mong gi bsnyen pa gnyis dang mchog gi bsnyen pa gnyis dang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi bsnyen pa gnyis dang mchog gi bsnyen pa gnyis dang rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are two common approaches and two supreme approaches, making four.

original: nye bar sgrub la sogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi'o zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nye bar sgrub la sogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi'o zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: The near attainment and so on are also four.

original: de la dang po thun mong gi bsnyen pa gcig ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la dang po thun mong gi bsnyen pa gcig ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The first common approach is fourfold.

original: mchog gi bsnyen pa gcig kyang ye shes bdud rtsi ste /
analyzed: mchog gi bsnyen pa gcig kyang ye shes bdud rtsi ste /
translated: The supreme approach is also one, the nectar of gnosis.

original: bar gyi srid pa'i sems las 'od du zhu zhing bskul ba las bdag po'i lha 'byung bas te /
analyzed: bar gyi srid pa'i sems las 'od du zhu zhing bskul ba las bdag po'i lha 'byung bas te /
translated: The master deity arises from the melting and urging of the mind of the intermediate existence.

original: 'di gtso bo 'ba' zhig la gtogs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur bas na mchog gi bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gtso bo 'ba' zhig la gtogs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur bas na mchog gi bsnyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since this is a branch that belongs to the principal deity alone, it is called the supreme approximation.

original: de bas na yan lag gzhan yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yan lag gzhan yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the other branches are also called that.

original: rdo rje rnam pa bzhi po de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje rnam pa bzhi po de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The same four vajras are taught:

original: dang po stong pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po stong pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first is emptiness, etc.

original: de yang sa bon @193b gyi 'od kyis bskul ba'i bde bar gshegs pa rnams zhal du zhugs pa zhu bar gyur pa padma'i nang du gnas pa ni dang po stong pa nyid byang chub ste /
analyzed: de yang sa bon @193b gyi 'od kyis bskul ba'i bde bar gshegs pa rnams zhal du zhugs pa zhu bar gyur pa padma'i nang du gnas pa ni dang po stong pa nyid byang chub ste /
translated: Moreover, the sugatas, impelled by the light of the seed, enter the mouth and melt. Abiding in the lotus, the first is the enlightenment of emptiness,

original: sa bon la sogs pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty of the seed, etc.

original: de las gtso bo 'ba' zhig gi sa bon bcu dgur gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de las gtso bo 'ba' zhig gi sa bon bcu dgur gyur pa ni /
translated: From that, the seed of the principal deity alone becomes nineteen.

original: gnyis pa sa bon bsdus pa mi zhes so ;
analyzed: gnyis pa sa bon bsdus pa mi zhes so ;
translated: The second is the gathering of the seed, the man.

original: / de las rang nyid dam bdag pos gtso bo byas pa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: / de las rang nyid dam bdag pos gtso bo byas pa'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa ni /
translated: From that, one generates the mandala with oneself or the lord as the principal deity.

original: gsum pa gzugs ni rdzogs pa ste //
analyzed: gsum pa gzugs ni rdzogs pa ste //
translated: The third is the perfect form.

original: zhes bya'o // de nyid badzra dhrik la sogs pa'i sngags kyis rang rang gdan la bkod pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nyid badzra dhrik la sogs pa'i sngags kyis rang rang gdan la bkod pa ni /
translated: Then, with the mantras of Vajradhātvīśvarī and so forth, one should arrange them on their respective seats.

original: zhi ba yi ge dgod pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba yi ge dgod pa'o //
translated: That is the “peaceful arrangement of the syllables. ”

original: zhes so // de bas na /
analyzed: zhes so // de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rdo rje rnam bzhi 'di dag gis //
analyzed: rdo rje rnam bzhi 'di dag gis //
translated: with these four vajra [mantras],

original: thun mong bsnyen pa bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: thun mong bsnyen pa bsgrub par bya //
translated: one should accomplish the common approach.

original: zhes te / lha thams cad la gtogs pa'i phyir thun mong gi bsnyen pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: zhes te / lha thams cad la gtogs pa'i phyir thun mong gi bsnyen pa zhes bya la /
translated: Because they belong to all the deities, they are called the “common approach. ”

original: yan lag gzhan rnams kyang thams cad la gtogs pa'i phyir thun mong gi nye bar sgrub pa la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan rnams kyang thams cad la gtogs pa'i phyir thun mong gi nye bar sgrub pa la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the other limbs also belong to all [deities], and so are the common near-accomplishment and so forth.

original: mchog gi ye shes bdud rtsi zhes te /
analyzed: mchog gi ye shes bdud rtsi zhes te /
translated: The supreme wisdom elixir is the supreme approach and so forth.

original: de ni ye shes bdud rtsi gong ma lta bus mchog gi bsnyen pa la sogs pa byas la thun mong gi bsnyen pa 'di bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de ni ye shes bdud rtsi gong ma lta bus mchog gi bsnyen pa la sogs pa byas la thun mong gi bsnyen pa 'di bya'o zhes so //
translated: That is, one should perform the supreme approach and so forth with the previously explained wisdom elixir, and then perform this common approach.

original: mchog gi bsnyen pa gnyis pa phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //🔽thun mong gi bsnyen pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mchog gi bsnyen pa gnyis pa phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro // thun mong gi bsnyen pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The second supreme approach will be explained later.

original: sbyor ba drug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba drug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to explain the two common approaches, [the Bhagavān] declares the six branches, and so forth.

original: yan lag drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six limbs?

original: so sor spyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: so sor spyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the individual practices, etc.

original: de la dang por so sor spyod pa bstan pa /
analyzed: de la dang por so sor spyod pa bstan pa /
translated: Among them, first the teaching of the individual practices:

original: dbang po bcu zhes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pa lnga dang / gzugs la sogs pa lnga ni tshogs dang bcas pa la dbang byed pas na dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po bcu zhes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pa lnga dang / gzugs la sogs pa lnga ni tshogs dang bcas pa la dbang byed pas na dbang po rnams te /
translated: The ten faculties, etc. The five beginning with the eye and the five beginning with form, together with their collections, are the faculties because they exercise control.

original: de rang rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam la gnas pa las 'dod pa lnga'i ngo bor so sor spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rang rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam la gnas pa las 'dod pa lnga'i ngo bor so sor spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: From the mere abiding in their own natures, the individual practices in the nature of the five enjoyments are called.

original: gnyis pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag bstan pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag bstan pa /
translated: Second, the teaching of the limbs of concentration:

original: 'dod pa lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five enjoyments, etc.

original: 'dod pa lnga la sangs rgyas lnga'i rang bzhin yan lag lnga brtag pa ni bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga la sangs rgyas lnga'i rang bzhin yan lag lnga brtag pa ni bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: The investigation of the five enjoyments in the nature of the five Buddhas is called concentration.

original: yan lag lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five limbs?

original: bsam gtan de rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan de rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those concentrations, etc.

original: gzhan dang mthun par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang mthun par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught in accordance with another.

original: rtog pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang so sor bstan pa /
analyzed: rtog pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang so sor bstan pa /
translated: The individual natures of investigation, etc. are also taught individually.

original: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The secret and so forth.

original: de la thabs dang shes rab de'i bde ba ni gsang ba gsum ste rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la thabs dang shes rab de'i bde ba ni gsang ba gsum ste rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the bliss of that method and wisdom is the three secrets, which are realized.

original: shes rab de nyid la @194a * //
analyzed: shes rab de nyid la @194a * //
translated: That wisdom itself

original: bud med gnyis kyi ngo bor longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bud med gnyis kyi ngo bor longs spyod pa'o //
translated: is enjoyed in the nature of two women.

original: de 'dra ba'i gzugs la rangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i gzugs la rangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of delight in such a form is joy.

original: de'i 'og tu bde ba bsdus pa'i khyad par ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bde ba bsdus pa'i khyad par ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, the special collection of bliss is called bliss.

original: de nas rang gi sems ye shes dang shes bya'i cha rnam par zad pa'i ngo bo rtog pa thams cad dang bral pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi sems ye shes dang shes bya'i cha rnam par zad pa'i ngo bo rtog pa thams cad dang bral pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba ni rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, one’s mind, the nature of the aspect of the gnosis and the object of knowledge, free from all concepts, is the coemergent joy, which is called one-pointed.

original: go rims bzhin du mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the nature of Akṣobhya and so forth, respectively.

original: gsum pa dbugs dgag gtong gi yan lag bstan pa /
analyzed: gsum pa dbugs dgag gtong gi yan lag bstan pa /
translated: The third is the explanation of the branch of blocking and releasing the breath.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Buddha” and so forth.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la gnas pas sems bying bar song na sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos po zhi ba gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa kun la rab tu gnas pa ye shes rnam pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dbugs 'byung ba lnga'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa /
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la gnas pas sems bying bar song na sangs rgyas kun gyi dngos po zhi ba gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa kun la rab tu gnas pa ye shes rnam pa lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dbugs 'byung ba lnga'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa /
translated: If the mind of one abiding in subtle yoga becomes slack, one should imagine the five exhalations, which are the nature of the five aspects of pristine awareness, abiding in the form of a sphere, which is the pacification of all things of all buddhas, and which is the abode of all desired things, such as form.

original: gong bu'i gzugs zhes te /
analyzed: gong bu'i gzugs zhes te /
translated: The phrase “the form of a sphere” is a remainder from the root text.

original: rang gi lha'i mtshan ma phra mo la dkyil 'khor gnas pa rang gi rdo rje'i dbus lcags kyu lta bus ze'u 'bru'i rnam pa las phyung nas rig ma'i sna rtser rab brtags la ting nge 'dzin gsum pa la spro bsdu bya'o zhes pa'i tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i mtshan ma phra mo la dkyil 'khor gnas pa rang gi rdo rje'i dbus lcags kyu lta bus ze'u 'bru'i rnam pa las phyung nas rig ma'i sna rtser rab brtags la ting nge 'dzin gsum pa la spro bsdu bya'o zhes pa'i tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: The subtle sign of one’s deity, which is the abode of the maṇḍala, is drawn out by the hook-like center of one’s vajra from the form of the anthers and is well imagined at the tip of the nose of the knowledge woman. One should emanate and gather into the third meditative stabilization.

original: de mtshon pa tsam du phyag mtshan cig gsungs pa /
analyzed: de mtshon pa tsam du phyag mtshan cig gsungs pa /
translated: The root text mentions only an illustration of that:

original: rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa //
analyzed: rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa //
translated: A jewel of five colors.

original: zhes te / yungs kar gyi 'bru tshod tsam mo //
analyzed: zhes te / yungs kar gyi 'bru tshod tsam mo //
translated: It is the size of a mustard seed.

original: des na 'khor lo dang padma ni tsa na ka'i 'bru tsam mo //
analyzed: des na 'khor lo dang padma ni tsa na ka'i 'bru tsam mo //
translated: Therefore, the wheel and the lotus are the size of a chickpea.

original: rdo rje dang ral gri ni nas tsam mo zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang ral gri ni nas tsam mo zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the vajra and the sword are the size of a barley grain.

original: de ni dbugs dgag gtong ba zhes su bshad ces te /
analyzed: de ni dbugs dgag gtong ba zhes su bshad ces te /
translated: That is explained as “stopping and releasing the breath.”

original: dgag pa dang gtong ba gsum gyis rnam par bsgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgag pa dang gtong ba gsum gyis rnam par bsgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “accomplishment by means of the three: stopping, releasing, and holding.”

original: bzhi pa gzung ba'i yan lag bstan pa /
analyzed: bzhi pa gzung ba'i yan lag bstan pa /
translated: The fourth branch is taught:

original: rang sngags zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang sngags zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “One’s own mantra, etc.”

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la gnas pas rang gi sa bon thig le'i gzugs su gnas pa ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar bsams la rang gi dbugs thig le la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor la gnas pas rang gi sa bon thig le'i gzugs su gnas pa ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar bsams la rang gi dbugs thig le la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One who abides in subtle yoga should imagine one’s seed in the form of a drop at the heart of the gnosis being and place one’s breath in the drop.

original: rang dbang zhes pa ni rang gi srog gi dbang po dbugs de nyid do //
analyzed: rang dbang zhes pa ni rang gi srog gi dbang po dbugs de nyid do //
translated: “One’s own” means one’s own life faculty, that very breath.

original: mchog tu gyur bas na rin po che ste /🔽bkag nas dmigs pa la gzung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur bas na rin po che ste / bkag nas dmigs pa la gzung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is a “jewel” because it is supreme.🔽Stopping it, one should hold the visualization.

original: de gzung ba ni sems 'gog pa'i rdo rje gyur nas brtan par gyur pa'i mtshan ma nye bar 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gzung ba ni sems 'gog pa'i rdo rje gyur nas brtan par gyur pa'i mtshan ma nye bar 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: That holding is the sign of the stabilization of the mind becoming the vajra of stopping.

original: mtshan ma de yang smig rgyu 'dra ba la sogs pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma de yang smig rgyu 'dra ba la sogs pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those signs also become five, such as like a mirage.

original: de yang sa rnam par log pas de'i 'od @194b zer smig rgyu 'dra ba 'byung ba ni dang po ste /
analyzed: de yang sa rnam par log pas de'i 'od @194b zer smig rgyu 'dra ba 'byung ba ni dang po ste /
translated: Moreover, from the reversal of earth, its light rays like a mirage arise, which is the first.

original: chu rnam par log pa las du ba lta bu 'byung ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: chu rnam par log pa las du ba lta bu 'byung ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: From the reversal of water, like smoke arises, which is the second.

original: me rnam par log pas mkha' snang zhes pa ni srin bu me khyer lta bu ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: me rnam par log pas mkha' snang zhes pa ni srin bu me khyer lta bu ni gsum pa'o //
translated: From the reversal of fire, like a butter lamp blazing is the third.

original: rlung rnam par log pas mar me ltar 'bar ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rlung rnam par log pas mar me ltar 'bar ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: From the reversal of wind, like a mirage arises, which is the fourth.

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par gyur pas de'i 'od zer zab gsal gyi ye shes la rag la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par gyur pas de'i 'od zer zab gsal gyi ye shes la rag la /
translated: From the reversal of consciousness, its light rays are dependent on the gnosis of profound clarity.

original: nye ba'i rtags mtshan ma la sogs pa'i gzugs /
analyzed: nye ba'i rtags mtshan ma la sogs pa'i gzugs /
translated: The signs of the near attainment and so on are

original: sprin med nam mkha' lta bur ni //
analyzed: sprin med nam mkha' lta bur ni //
translated: like a cloudless sky.

original: rtag tu snang ba lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu snang ba lnga pa'o //
translated: The five lights are always present.

original: zhes so // de rnams rnal 'byor pa bzhir 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de rnams rnal 'byor pa bzhir 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: Those are the signs of the four yogas.

original: lnga pa rjes su dran pa'i yan lag gsungs pa /🔽brtan 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa rjes su dran pa'i yan lag gsungs pa /🔽brtan 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fifth limb is the recollection.

original: phra mo la gnas pas brtan par gyur pa'i mtshan ma lnga mthong nas rdo rje'i lam nas nam mkha'i khams kun du ji skad gsungs pa'i cho gas bcu gcig spro bar bya zhes pas so //
analyzed: phra mo la gnas pas brtan par gyur pa'i mtshan ma lnga mthong nas rdo rje'i lam nas nam mkha'i khams kun du ji skad gsungs pa'i cho gas bcu gcig spro bar bya zhes pas so //
translated: Having seen the five signs of stability through abiding in the subtle, one should emanate the eleven as taught by the rite in the space element through the vajra path.

original: des spro ba ni rjes su dran pa gang bsgoms pa de dang 'dra bar spro bar bya ba ni rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des spro ba ni rjes su dran pa gang bsgoms pa de dang 'dra bar spro bar bya ba ni rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Emanation by that is the emanation like whatever is cultivated in the recollection, and it is called “recollection.”

original: so sor snang ba de las skye //
analyzed: so sor snang ba de las skye //
translated: The individual appearance arises from that.

original: zhes pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba las sngon mthong ba'i don so sor snang ba de las skye'o zhes so //🔽de nas ni drug pa ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba las sngon mthong ba'i don so sor snang ba de las skye'o zhes so // de nas ni drug pa ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This means that the individual appearance of the object seen previously arises from the emanation and gathering.

original: thabs dang shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, in order to teach the sixth branch, meditative stabilization, it is said, “means and wisdom,” and so on.

original: de la thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid snyoms par 'jug pas dngos po thams cad sa bon gyis drangs nas rang gi sa bon la gong bu'i tshul gyis bsdus nas rang gi snying gi dbus su thig le'i gzugs rnam par bsgoms nas yang de la lha'i 'khor
analyzed: de la thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid snyoms par 'jug pas dngos po thams cad sa bon gyis drangs nas rang gi sa bon la gong bu'i tshul gyis bsdus nas rang gi snying gi dbus su thig le'i gzugs rnam par bsgoms nas yang de la lha'i 'khor
translated: There, by the union of the nature of method and wisdom, all things are drawn in by the seed, gathered into one’s own seed in the manner of a ball, and meditated on in the form of a drop in the center of one’s heart.

original: lo'i ye shes yud tsam gyis rdzogs par bsgoms nas de la yang de bzhin du bsgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba yin zhes so //
analyzed: lo'i ye shes yud tsam gyis rdzogs par bsgoms nas de la yang de bzhin du bsgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba yin zhes so //
translated: Then, in an instant, one meditates on the gnosis of the circle of deities complete there, and also meditates on that. This is called “samādhi.”

original: da ni yan lag drug so so'i phan yon gsungs pa //
analyzed: da ni yan lag drug so so'i phan yon gsungs pa //
translated: Now, the benefits of each of the six branches are taught.

original: so sor spyod pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: so sor spyod pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Practicing each” and so on is stated.

original: bsam gtan gyi mthun dpag tu med pas na rigs pas mi dpag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi mthun dpag tu med pas na rigs pas mi dpag go //
translated: Since the benefits of concentration are immeasurable, they cannot be measured by logic.

original: de bas na 'di rnams la yang sku dang / byed pa dang / dbang dang / mkhyen pa rnams lha thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir thun mong gi bsnyen pa la sogs par bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di rnams la yang sku dang / byed pa dang / dbang dang / mkhyen pa rnams lha thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir thun mong gi bsnyen pa la sogs par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since the bodies, activities, powers, and wisdoms of these [buddhas] are common to all deities, they are explained as the common approach, and so on.

original: da ni nye bar sgrub pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang ci rigs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni nye bar sgrub pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang ci rigs par gsungs pa /
translated: Now, other aspects such as the near-accomplishment are taught as appropriate.

original: snying po de ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying po de ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The essence of that, etc.

original: @195a * // de yang thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i thugs ka'i phyag mtshan gyi dbus su snying po dang zhes pa h'um la sogs pa bsam zhes so //
analyzed: @195a * // de yang thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i thugs ka'i phyag mtshan gyi dbus su snying po dang zhes pa h'um la sogs pa bsam zhes so //
translated: Moreover, the essence in the middle of the heart-cakra of Cittavajra, etc., is the thought of the essence, i.e., the hūṃ, etc.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: zla ba rdo rje'i sbyor bas lta //
analyzed: zla ba rdo rje'i sbyor bas lta //
translated: One should view it by the union of the moon and vajra.

original: zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i zla ba'i gdan la bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i zla ba'i gdan la bsam mo //
translated: One should think of it on the moon seat of inseparability.🔽By the supreme weapon, etc.

original: mtshon cha mchog gis zhes pa ni h'um la sogs pa'i 'od zer lha mo dang bcas pas zhes pas so //
analyzed: mtshon cha mchog gis zhes pa ni h'um la sogs pa'i 'od zer lha mo dang bcas pas zhes pas so //
translated: means by the light-rays of the hūṃ, etc., together with the goddesses.

original: sngags kyi gzugs kyi tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: sngags kyi gzugs kyi tshul gyis ni //
translated: In the manner of the form of the mantra,

original: zhes pa ni des shes rab dang ldan pa'i rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i tshogs spyan drangs nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni des shes rab dang ldan pa'i rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i tshogs spyan drangs nas /
translated: means that one should invite the assembly of the retinue abiding in one’s maṇḍala endowed with wisdom.

original: byang chub tshigs bcad ces pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub tshigs bcad ces pa ni //
translated: The verse of enlightenment, etc.

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas thugs 'chang ba //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas thugs 'chang ba //
translated: The glorious one who holds the mind of the Buddha,

original: zhes pa la sogs pas yang dag par sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas yang dag par sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams /
translated: Thus, the maṇḍalas of correct union

original: sems ni sngags kyi dngos bya ste //
analyzed: sems ni sngags kyi dngos bya ste //
translated: are the mind, the nature of mantra,

original: rang gi sngags kyi ngo bo la thim nas rang gi thugs kyi rdo rje rgyal ba thams cad kyi ye shes kyi gzugs bsgyur ba de dang gnyis su med par bsgom pa ni nye bar sgrub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi sngags kyi ngo bo la thim nas rang gi thugs kyi rdo rje rgyal ba thams cad kyi ye shes kyi gzugs bsgyur ba de dang gnyis su med par bsgom pa ni nye bar sgrub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: dissolving into the nature of one’s mantra, and meditating on nonduality with that form of the gnosis of all the victors, one’s mind vajra.

original: 'dis sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams dang don nye bar sgrub pas na de skad de /
analyzed: 'dis sangs rgyas kyi tshogs rnams dang don nye bar sgrub pas na de skad de /
translated: This is called “near attainment,” because it is the attainment of the meaning of the assembly of buddhas.

original: 'di na chung ngu'i sgrub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di na chung ngu'i sgrub par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the lesser attainment.

original: da ni mchog gi bsnyen sgrub bzhi la gnas pas rang gi rigs kyi bu mo lhan cig tu phyag rgya chen po sgrub par ston te /
analyzed: da ni mchog gi bsnyen sgrub bzhi la gnas pas rang gi rigs kyi bu mo lhan cig tu phyag rgya chen po sgrub par ston te /
translated: Now, the four of supreme approach and attainment are taught in order to accomplish the great seal together with one’s daughter of the family, abiding in one’s own family.

original: ji srid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “As long as” and so on.

original: de gnyis zhes pa ni zhi ba'i sbyor ba dang / drag shul gyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes pa ni zhi ba'i sbyor ba dang / drag shul gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Those two” are the peaceful union and the wrathful union.

original: mthong ba de srid du zhes pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyag rgya chen po thob pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba de srid du zhes pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyag rgya chen po thob pa'o //
translated: “As long as one sees” means that one attains the great seal of consecration.

original: de yang dang por bya bar 'os pa tshogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhi ba'i sbyor ba nyid kyis lha mo'i 'dod pa thams cad la longs spyod cing zla ba drug gi bar du bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de yang dang por bya bar 'os pa tshogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhi ba'i sbyor ba nyid kyis lha mo'i 'dod pa thams cad la longs spyod cing zla ba drug gi bar du bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Moreover, the practitioner who is suitable to perform the rite first enjoys all the desires of the goddess by the method of pacification and should practice for six months.

original: de ltar gnas pas gang gsungs pa'i dngos grub mthong bar ma gyur na de'i tshe ji skad du gsungs pa'i cho ga dang ldan par lan gsum du brtsam par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pas gang gsungs pa'i dngos grub mthong bar ma gyur na de'i tshe ji skad du gsungs pa'i cho ga dang ldan par lan gsum du brtsam par bya'o zhes so //
translated: If, abiding in that way, one does not see the powers that are taught, then at that time one should perform the rite as taught three times.

original: gal te de tsam yang thig ler gnas par ma gyur na de'i tshe le'u bcu pa dang bcu bzhi pa las gsungs pa'i drag shul gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gal te de tsam yang thig ler gnas par ma gyur na de'i tshe le'u bcu pa dang bcu bzhi pa las gsungs pa'i drag shul gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
translated: If even that much does not bring about the abiding of the drop, then at that time one should perform the fierce rite as taught in the tenth and fourteenth chapters.

original: le'u bcu bzhi pa'i phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga la thugs kyi rdo rje la sogs pa gsum la shes rab mthar byed la sogs pa'i phur bus gdab po zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: le'u bcu bzhi pa'i phur bus gdab pa'i cho ga la thugs kyi rdo rje la sogs pa gsum la shes rab mthar byed la sogs pa'i phur bus gdab po zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In the ritual of the dagger-stake of chapter fourteen, one should know that the three, Mind-vajra and so forth, are staked with the dagger-stake of Wisdom-Slayer and so forth.

original: rigs kyi dbye ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: For that purpose, there is the verse beginning with “the division of the families.”

original: de yang bcu pa @195b las gsungs pa'i de ma thag tu padma'i nang du me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i bsgrub bya dam tshig las nyams par bsams nas rigs kyi khro bo phur bu'i gzugs su gnas pa rang gi rdo rje las byung ste gnas rnams su btab
analyzed: de yang bcu pa @195b las gsungs pa'i de ma thag tu padma'i nang du me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i bsgrub bya dam tshig las nyams par bsams nas rigs kyi khro bo phur bu'i gzugs su gnas pa rang gi rdo rje las byung ste gnas rnams su btab
translated: Moreover, immediately after the tenth chapter, one should imagine the victim, who has fallen from his pledge, in the center of a lotus in the middle of a fire mandala, and the family wrathful one, abiding in the form of a dagger-stake, arises from one’s vajra and strikes the victim’s places.

original: pas sngags kyis lus thal ba ltar gtor nas shes rab mar me'i tshul du gnas pa rang gi mi shigs pa'i thig le la bcug par byas pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: pas sngags kyis lus thal ba ltar gtor nas shes rab mar me'i tshul du gnas pa rang gi mi shigs pa'i thig le la bcug par byas pas 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: By the mantra, the body is scattered like dust, and the wisdom, abiding in the manner of a lamp, is inserted into one’s indestructible drop.

original: da ni le'u dang po las de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor lo nyid kyi sku zhugs par mdzad de zhes pa nas /
analyzed: da ni le'u dang po las de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor lo nyid kyi sku zhugs par mdzad de zhes pa nas /
translated: Now, in the first chapter, it says, “Having caused the wheel of the Tathāgata to enter one’s own body,” and so forth.

original: de bud med kyi gzugs su byung bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa de rnams rig ma la zhugs par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bud med kyi gzugs su byung bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa de rnams rig ma la zhugs par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The statement that became a woman's form is for the sake of clarifying the entry into the knowledge consort.

original: 'dod chags zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great passion and so forth.

original: 'dod chags chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: The wheel of wisdom is the meditative stabilization of great passion.

original: sangs rgyas bsdus nas de spyan ma la sogs pa'i bud med dgur spros nas bsgrub bya zhes pa ni rang gi rig ma la chud par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsdus nas de spyan ma la sogs pa'i bud med dgur spros nas bsgrub bya zhes pa ni rang gi rig ma la chud par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Having gathered the buddhas, having emanated them as the nine women such as Lochana, the object of practice is to be caused to enter one's knowledge consort.

original: da ni ye shes bdud rtsir gyur pa la spyan la sogs pa'i glus bslang ba'i sku ni mchog gi bsnyen par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ye shes bdud rtsir gyur pa la spyan la sogs pa'i glus bslang ba'i sku ni mchog gi bsnyen par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to worship the body that is aroused by the song of Lochana and so forth with the wisdom nectar,

original: spros nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spros nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the emanation and so forth.

original: de la spros nas zhes pa ni 'od kyi gong bu las spros nas zhes so //
analyzed: de la spros nas zhes pa ni 'od kyi gong bu las spros nas zhes so //
translated: There, emanation is from the orb of light.

original: phyag rgya bzhi ni lha mo bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi ni lha mo bzhi'o //
translated: The four seals are the four goddesses.

original: bskor nas brtag pa ni go rims bzhin du bskor bas brtag pa zhes so //
analyzed: bskor nas brtag pa ni go rims bzhin du bskor bas brtag pa zhes so //
translated: The examination by circumambulation is the examination by circumambulation in order.

original: bdag nyid zla ba zhu ba'i ngo bo dbus su gnas par byas la de rnams kyis bskul ba dang sa bon las gyur pa'i phyag mtshan gyi dbus kyi 'od kyis 'khor lo thams cad ces pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams rang gi lha'i gzugs su byas nas bsdu bar bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: bdag nyid zla ba zhu ba'i ngo bo dbus su gnas par byas la de rnams kyis bskul ba dang sa bon las gyur pa'i phyag mtshan gyi dbus kyi 'od kyis 'khor lo thams cad ces pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams rang gi lha'i gzugs su byas nas bsdu bar bya'o zhes te /
translated: Having made oneself the essence of melted moon in the center, and having been urged by them, the essence of the seed-syllable, the essence of the hand-symbol in the center, the light of all the wheels, and so on, having made the Buddhas into one’s own deity form, one should gather them.

original: bkug nas sa bon la gzhug go zhes so //
analyzed: bkug nas sa bon la gzhug go zhes so //
translated: Having summoned them, one should enter them into the seed-syllable.

original: de nas de gyur pa'i lus rdo rje kun gyi ngo bor bya zhing byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyi sku lha mos snying po la bskul ba'i stobs kyis 'das pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin ye shes lta bu'i lus su bsgom pa ni
analyzed: de nas de gyur pa'i lus rdo rje kun gyi ngo bor bya zhing byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyi sku lha mos snying po la bskul ba'i stobs kyis 'das pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin ye shes lta bu'i lus su bsgom pa ni
translated: Then, having made the body transformed into the essence of all vajras, the body of the nature of enlightenment, the yoginīs urge the essence of the deity. By the power of that, one should meditate on the nature of all Buddhas, past and so on, as a body of gnosis.

original: mchog gi bsnyen pa zhes bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: mchog gi bsnyen pa zhes bya'o zhes so //
translated: This is called “the supreme service.”

original: las kyi dbye bas kha dog bye brag tu gyur par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las kyi dbye bas kha dog bye brag tu gyur par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the specific colors of the deities according to the different activities, he says:

original: 'dod pa yis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa yis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By desire” and so on.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis thugs phye ste //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis thugs phye ste //
translated: Having opened the mind with suchness,

original: zhes pa ni khro bo rnams kyi nyams dang thugs bye brag tu gyur @196a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khro bo rnams kyi nyams dang thugs bye brag tu gyur @196a * //
translated: This is the special experience and mind of the wrathful ones.

original: te ; thugs ni rnam par zhi ba ston zla'i rgya mtsho'i dbus dang 'dra //
analyzed: te ; thugs ni rnam par zhi ba ston zla'i rgya mtsho'i dbus dang 'dra //
translated: Their mind is shown to be peaceful, like the center of the autumn moon.

original: zhes so // dbang bskur bas ni rang gi rgyu //
analyzed: zhes so // dbang bskur bas ni rang gi rgyu //
translated: By the consecration, one is distinguished from the cause.

original: bzhi yis 'bras bu phye ba yin //
analyzed: bzhi yis 'bras bu phye ba yin //
translated: By the four, one is distinguished from the result.

original: spyi bor dbang bskur bas rgyu ma yin pa las phye ba yin la /
analyzed: spyi bor dbang bskur bas rgyu ma yin pa las phye ba yin la /
translated: By the consecration on the crown, one is distinguished from the non-cause.

original: bzhi'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas pas 'bras bu ma yin pa las bye brag phye ba yin zhes so //
analyzed: bzhi'i tshul gyis rnam par gnas pas 'bras bu ma yin pa las bye brag phye ba yin zhes so //
translated: By the four modes of abiding, one is distinguished from the non-result.

original: rang sngags kyis ni chos mar 'gyur //
analyzed: rang sngags kyis ni chos mar 'gyur //
translated: One's mantra is the Dharma consort.

original: zhes pa ni rang gi shes rab ma rang gi sngags kyis cho ga bzhin du bskyed par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi shes rab ma rang gi sngags kyis cho ga bzhin du bskyed par bya'o zhes so //
translated: This means that one should generate one's wisdom consort with one's own mantra according to the ritual.

original: rig ma la chos kyi rgya zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa' rig ma bye brag tu phyed de /
analyzed: rig ma la chos kyi rgya zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa' rig ma bye brag tu phyed de /
translated: The Dharma seal of the knowledge consort is the distinction of the knowledge being from the knowledge consort.

original: shes rab kyis thabs dang 'dra'o ;
analyzed: shes rab kyis thabs dang 'dra'o ;
translated: Wisdom is like the method.

original: / ye shes dpa' mo'i gnas pa bkag pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: / ye shes dpa' mo'i gnas pa bkag pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The negation of the abode of the knowledge being is established.

original: des thabs kyi chas shes rab bye brag tu byas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des thabs kyi chas shes rab bye brag tu byas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the statement, “The method is distinguished by the insight.”

original: de bzhin du gzhan las yang thabs kyi snying gar shes rab kyi gzhag pa yang de'i rim par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan las yang thabs kyi snying gar shes rab kyi gzhag pa yang de'i rim par shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in other [texts], the statement, “The method is placed at the heart of the insight,” should be understood in that order.

original: da ni le'u bco lnga pa las /
analyzed: da ni le'u bco lnga pa las /
translated: Now, in the fifteenth chapter [of the Cakrasaṃvara Tantra],

original: rdo rje spyan gyi gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: rdo rje spyan gyi gzugs la sogs //
translated: the form of the vajra eye, and so forth,

original: gtsug tor mnyes par byed pa yin //
analyzed: gtsug tor mnyes par byed pa yin //
translated: is the pleasing of the uṣṇīṣa.

original: zhes pa'i gtsug tor gyi sgra la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gtsug tor gyi sgra la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the term uṣṇīṣa and so forth,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [the Hevajra Tantra] says “cakravartin” and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi dbu la gnas pas gtsug tor zhes pa'i sgra brjod la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi dbu la gnas pas gtsug tor zhes pa'i sgra brjod la /
translated: Since it abides on the head of the six tathāgatas, it is called the uṣṇīṣa.

original: mdzes par byed pa'i don gyis na rgyal po zhes so //
analyzed: mdzes par byed pa'i don gyis na rgyal po zhes so //
translated: Since it beautifies, it is called the king.

original: longs spyod bzhi ni lha mo bzhi ste /
analyzed: longs spyod bzhi ni lha mo bzhi ste /
translated: The four enjoyments are the four goddesses.

original: gnyis su med par longs spyod pas rig pa chen po'i rgyud yin pas na rig pa'i rgyal mo zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis su med par longs spyod pas rig pa chen po'i rgyud yin pas na rig pa'i rgyal mo zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Since they enjoy nondually, it is the great knowledge tantra, and therefore it is explained as the knowledge queen.

original: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
translated: The others have been explained.

original: da ni dbang bskur ba bsam gtan gyi mchog yin te /
analyzed: da ni dbang bskur ba bsam gtan gyi mchog yin te /
translated: Now, the consecration is the supreme meditation.

original: phyi rol gyi mchog ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mchog ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is the supreme external consecration,🔽[the Bhagavān] declares,

original: thams cad bsam gtan 'khor lo yis //🔽dbang bskur ba ni bsngags pa ste //
analyzed: thams cad bsam gtan 'khor lo yis // dbang bskur ba ni bsngags pa ste //
translated: The consecration by the wheel of meditation🔽is praised as the supreme.

original: zhes rang gi dbu la rigs kyi dbang phyug gzhag pa ni mchog gam gtso bo zhes so //
analyzed: zhes rang gi dbu la rigs kyi dbang phyug gzhag pa ni mchog gam gtso bo zhes so //
translated: Placing the lord of the family on one's head is the supreme or principal [consecration].

original: de yan chad kyis rang gi gzugs rdzogs par byas nas rig ma dang lhan cig tu gnyis su med par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yan chad kyis rang gi gzugs rdzogs par byas nas rig ma dang lhan cig tu gnyis su med par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Up to this point, having perfected one's own form, one should make oneself nondual with the knowledge woman. In order to demonstrate that, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: mchog gi sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: mchog gi sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
translated: By this supreme union,

original: zhes pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa gsungs so //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares.

original: de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas rig ma dang lhan cig tu bskyed nas dkyil 'khor dbyung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas rig ma dang lhan cig tu bskyed nas dkyil 'khor dbyung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having generated [oneself] together with the knowledge woman by the previously mentioned process, one should emit the mandala.

original: rang sngags bshad pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang sngags bshad pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, [one should emit the mandala] with one's own mantra explained [above] and so forth.

original: rig ma dang lhan @196b cig pa'i skyes bu rdo rje gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa nas rjes su chags pa'i mtha' la thug pas gtso bo bsgrubs nas bdag dang 'dra ba dkyil 'khor 'byin pa chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bar du bskyed do zhes so //
analyzed: rig ma dang lhan @196b cig pa'i skyes bu rdo rje gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs pa nas rjes su chags pa'i mtha' la thug pas gtso bo bsgrubs nas bdag dang 'dra ba dkyil 'khor 'byin pa chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bar du bskyed do zhes so //
translated: From the consecration of the person with the knowledge woman by the three vajras, up to the end of passion, one should generate the principal deity, and then the mandala, up to the end of the great emanation, which is like oneself.

original: de kho na bstan pa /
analyzed: de kho na bstan pa /
translated: The teaching of reality

original: bsnyen pa'i dus zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i dus zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: is from “at the time of the approach” and so on.

original: mchog gi bsnyen pa'i dus na gtsug tor chen po zhes pa sangs rgyas gang yang rung ba'i gzugs su dmigs so //🔽sbyor ba zhes pa'i don ni chung du dang 'bring po'i 'bras bu bzhis dag par byas pa la sogs pa rjes su chags pa'i mtha' la thug pas dang po'i sbyor ba byas te thun mong gi bsnyen pa rdo rje cho ga bzhis chen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras
analyzed: mchog gi bsnyen pa'i dus na gtsug tor chen po zhes pa sangs rgyas gang yang rung ba'i gzugs su dmigs so // sbyor ba zhes pa'i don ni chung du dang 'bring po'i 'bras bu bzhis dag par byas pa la sogs pa rjes su chags pa'i mtha' la thug pas dang po'i sbyor ba byas te thun mong gi bsnyen pa rdo rje cho ga bzhis chen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras
translated: At the time of the supreme approach, one visualizes the great uṣṇīṣa, the form of any buddha.

original: bu skyed do //
analyzed: bu skyed do //
translated: The meaning of “application” is that, having purified with the four results of the lesser and medium, up to the end of passion, one performs the first application, and the common approach generates the result that is the natural outflow of the great.

original: de bzhin du thun mong gi nye bar sgrub pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du thun mong gi nye bar sgrub pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang gsungs pa /
translated: Likewise, other aspects such as the common near-accomplishment, etc. are taught.

original: nye bar sgrub pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar sgrub pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The near-accomplishment, etc.

analyzed: thugs byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas pa ni chen po'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //

original: sgrub pa chen po'i dus su thams cad la //

analyzed: de lta'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: gang gis she na /

analyzed: bskal pa bye ba stong du yang //

analyzed: bsgrub bya zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: de yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa po'i padma dang rdo rje reg pa gang yin pa de mchog gi bsnyen pa @197a * //

analyzed: zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub kyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro zhes so //

analyzed: de la rdo rje dang padma yang dag par zhugs pa'i 'og tu reg pa nye bar sgrub pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: sgrub pa dang nye ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bde ba chen po 'dis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu rang bzhin nyid kyis bde zhing spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes pa ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /

original: zhes pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /

original: dpal ldan zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

original: yang dag pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po de ni sangs rgyas kun gyi thabs kyis thob par bya ba yin no zhes so //

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de zhes te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de zhes te /

analyzed: chos thams cad don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu ro gcig pa'i phyir chos nyid de kho na bsgrub bya yin no zhes so // da ni le'u bcu gsum pa la sogs pa'i las bzhi'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since all phenomena are of one taste in the ultimate and the relative, that reality alone is to be accomplished.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor kun la rnal 'byor pas //

original: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /

analyzed: gang gang las dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: kha dog dang ldan la sogs pa dang ldan par ro //

original: de yang chung ngu 'am zhe na /
analyzed: de yang chung ngu 'am zhe na /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad dmigs nas su //

analyzed: zhes dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang ldan par byas nas zhes so //

analyzed: dam tshig mi zad bsgom par bya //

analyzed: zhes pa ni rig pa'i sngags kyis bsgom pa las byed par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: means that one will perform the action through meditation on the awareness mantra.

original: sngon du song ba'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngon du song ba'i rgyu gsungs pa /

analyzed: sku gsung thugs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

translated: Moreover, this should be understood extensively from the root tantra.🔽Now, in order to teach the meaning of the opening of chapter fifteen,

analyzed: da ni le'u bco lnga pa'i kha 'byed kyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: thams cad rdo rje @197b can kun la //
analyzed: thams cad rdo rje @197b can kun la //
translated: All those who possess the vajra,

analyzed: las rnams sna tshogs ji ltar bcol //

original: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'i lan gsungs pa /

analyzed: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: de yang bsgrub bya la nyes pa bsgo ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin khyad par rnams byas pa'i de ma thag tu bsgrub bya'i lus la thun mong du gyur pa'i srung ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par bsgoms nas zhes so //

translated: Then, imagining it to be an empty house, one should make a form of the victim out of mustard seed, or sand from a river bank, and so forth, as taught in the tantras, and generate oneself in the form of any wrathful one, naked or clothed.

analyzed: gos dang ldan par mtshan ma rkang pas mnan la bsgyings nas sngags bzla bar bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi dbye ba gzhan yang rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, one should know the other divisions of action in three ways.

analyzed: de nas sbyor ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o // mtshan ma mnan nas bzlas pa'am //

analyzed: zhes pa ni bzlas ma thag pa'am / le'u bcu bzhi pa'am /
translated: “Having suppressed the sign, one should repeat the mantra.”

original: bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the fourteenth chapter.

original: sbyin sreg khro bo rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: sbyin sreg khro bo rnal 'byor pa //
translated: “The wrathful yoga of the fire sacrifice.”

original: zhes pa ni le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni le'u bco lnga pa las gsungs pa'o //

original: gdug pa'i sems can bsam gtan gyis //🔽bza' ba ru ni rab tu brtag / ces pa ni bcu gsum pa'am /
analyzed: gdug pa'i sems can bsam gtan gyis // bza' ba ru ni rab tu brtag / ces pa ni bcu gsum pa'am /
translated: “The evil beings are to be imagined as food by the meditation.”

original: bco lnga par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bco lnga par gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the thirteenth or fifteenth chapter.

analyzed: de bas na mngon spyod kyi cho ga ni las kyis 'grub pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: da ni las bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa'i phyir / @198a * // zhi ba la ni zhi ba'i sems //
translated: Now, in order to teach the samādhi of the four actions,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “For pacification, a peaceful mind,” and so forth.

original: de ltar zhugs pa rnams kyi som nyi bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa rnams kyi som nyi bsal nas /
translated: Thus, having dispelled the doubts of those who have entered,

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku la sogs pa dang gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i sku la sogs pa la dmigs nas cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku la sogs pa dang gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i sku la sogs pa la dmigs nas cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs
translated: Then the Blessed One, etc.

original: pa'o // de rnams kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa'i mthus ye shes phul du byung ba yin pas de kho na la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'o // de rnams kyang rdo rje 'dzin pa'i mthus ye shes phul du byung ba yin pas de kho na la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And they, by the power of the Vajra Holder, are of the highest wisdom, and so it is said that they focus on him alone.

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag shin tu mgu nas sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i sgo nas stong pa de rnams la bstod nas khyad par du zhe sdang gi las 'ba' zhig gi sgo nas zhus pa dang lan gsungs pa /

translated: Now, those Bodhisattvas, being very pleased, having praised those emptinesses by way of the essence of the body, etc., ask about the special [topics], and the reply is given, [all] by way of the activity of anger alone.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la / thams cad mdzad la phyag 'tshal 'dud //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o // de la / thams cad mdzad la phyag 'tshal 'dud //

analyzed: ces pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las thams cad byed pa zhes so //
translated: means that he does all the actions, such as killing, etc.

original: de la dris par sku gsung thugs ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dris par sku gsung thugs ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply to that is the body, speech, and mind, and so forth.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid sku la sogs pa thob pas sems can nyid mnyam med dang mnyam pa ste ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid sku la sogs pa thob pas sems can nyid mnyam med dang mnyam pa ste ;
translated: Since the bodies, etc. of all sentient beings are pure, they attain the body, etc. of the nature of Vairocana, etc. Therefore, sentient beings are equal to the unequaled,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam zhes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam zhes so //
translated: equal to all buddhas.

original: 'o na de ci 'gog ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de ci 'gog ce na /
translated: Well then, what is that refuted?

original: bsgrub bya su yin sgrub po gang //
analyzed: bsgrub bya su yin sgrub po gang //
translated: Who is the object to be accomplished, and who is the one who accomplishes?

original: zhes te / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas nyid yin pas bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa po med do zhes so //
analyzed: zhes te / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas nyid yin pas bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa po med do zhes so //
translated: Since all sentient beings are buddhas, there is no object to be accomplished and no one who accomplishes.

original: des na sgrub pa'i dbang po bdag nyid chen po des mngon spyod kyi las kyis sangs rgyas thams cad gsod pas bdag nyid chen po ji ltar sdig pas mi gos te /

translated: Therefore, since that great being, the lord of accomplishment, kills all buddhas with the activity of wrath, how is that great being not defiled by sin?
