analyzed: gal te gos par gyur na 'bras bu bla na med pa'i byang chub tu ji ltar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: If he were defiled, how would there be the result of unsurpassed enlightenment? Thus it is asked.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis legs so ba'i tshig sngon du gsol nas de'i lan gsungs la ;
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis legs so ba'i tshig sngon du gsol nas de'i lan gsungs la ;
translated: Now, the Tathagatas, having first uttered the word “Excellent,” then spoke in reply.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, the Tathagatas, etc.

original: sems can gyi don la sems pa dang / ye shes kyi sku'i ngo bo dang / shes pa'i shes rab las byung ba dang / bde bar gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du sems dpa' chen po dang / @198b bdag nyid chen po dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la sems pa dang / ye shes kyi sku'i ngo bo dang / shes pa'i shes rab las byung ba dang / bde bar gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du sems dpa' chen po dang / @198b bdag nyid chen po dang /
translated: The word “hero” is used because of his intention to benefit sentient beings, “great being” because of the nature of his gnosis body, “great knowledge” because of his arising from the wisdom of knowledge, and “great worship” because of his pleasing all the Sugatas.

original: gsung dbyangs chen po dang / mchod ba chen po zhes pos nas legs so zhes tshig sngon du gsol lo //
analyzed: gsung dbyangs chen po dang / mchod ba chen po zhes pos nas legs so zhes tshig sngon du gsol lo //
translated: The word “excellent” is uttered first.

original: sgrub pa po slob dpon te /
analyzed: sgrub pa po slob dpon te /
translated: The practitioner is the master.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi 'khor lo der gtogs pa ste de'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi 'khor lo der gtogs pa ste de'i bdag po'o //
translated: He is the lord of the wheel of all the Buddhas, and belongs to it.

original: de bas na dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de bas na dpal ldan no //
translated: Therefore, he is glorious.

original: de lta bu'i byang chub kyi rdo rje can gyi dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i tshul gyis 'byin pa dang / sdud par byed kyi tha dad pa'i blos ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub kyi rdo rje can gyi dngos po thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i tshul gyis 'byin pa dang / sdud par byed kyi tha dad pa'i blos ma yin no //
translated: In that way, all things of the one who has the vajra of enlightenment are produced and gathered by the method of the illusion, and not by a different mind.

original: de bas na rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i tshul gyis las thams cad byed pas na slob dpon de'i sdig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i tshul gyis las thams cad byed pas na slob dpon de'i sdig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since all actions are performed by the method of a dream, the master does not have sin,

original: zhe sdang gis blang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis blang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not taken up by hatred.

original: de bzhin du phyugs gsad pa'i mchod sbyin lta bu ma yin pas bsod nams su yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyugs gsad pa'i mchod sbyin lta bu ma yin pas bsod nams su yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, since it is not like the sacrifice of killing cattle, it is not merit.

original: de bas na bsod nams dang sdig par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyur gyur par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na bsod nams dang sdig par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na byang chub kyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyur gyur par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in that way, it is not merit or sin, and in order to teach that it is the cause of the characteristic of enlightenment,

original: gang la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “that which is not . . .” and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi lta ba dang bral bas na sdig dang bsod nams su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lta ba dang bral bas na sdig dang bsod nams su mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is free from external views, it is not merit or sin.

original: snying rje chen pos 'dren par byed pas byang chub kho na'i rgyu yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos 'dren par byed pas byang chub kho na'i rgyu yin par gsungs so //
translated: Since it is led by great compassion, it is said to be the sole cause of enlightenment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mgon po de'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mgon po de'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Lord, etc.

original: mgon po de yis zhes pa ni sgrub pa po des 'jig par byed pa'i zhes yang dag par 'jig par byed pa'i las kyis lus thams cad 'jig par mdzad kyang las des ngan 'gror skye bar mi 'gyur zhing de nyid la goms par bslabs pas byang chub kyang
analyzed: mgon po de yis zhes pa ni sgrub pa po des 'jig par byed pa'i zhes yang dag par 'jig par byed pa'i las kyis lus thams cad 'jig par mdzad kyang las des ngan 'gror skye bar mi 'gyur zhing de nyid la goms par bslabs pas byang chub kyang
translated: The Lord, etc. means that although the Lord, i.e., the practitioner, destroys the body by the action of perfect destruction, by that action he is not born in the lower realms, and by training in cultivating that very thing, he will attain enlightenment.

original: rnyed sla bar 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: rnyed sla bar 'gyur zhes so //
translated: It is said that it will be easy to attain.

original: rmongs pa'i lus can de dag kyang //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i lus can de dag kyang //
translated: Those deluded embodied beings

original: cho ga ji lta bas bsad pas 'bras bu mchog thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cho ga ji lta bas bsad pas 'bras bu mchog thob par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that by killing in accordance with the rite, one attains the supreme result,

original: sngon ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said, Formerly, etc.

original: sngon shin tu mi bzad pa'i las byas pas gal te dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'i skye bo de rnams cho ga ji lta ba bzhin byas pa'i mthus sdig pa dang bral bar byas pas dmyal ba rnams kyi 'bras bu che zhes te /
analyzed: sngon shin tu mi bzad pa'i las byas pas gal te dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'i skye bo de rnams cho ga ji lta ba bzhin byas pa'i mthus sdig pa dang bral bar byas pas dmyal ba rnams kyi 'bras bu che zhes te /
translated: If those beings who have previously done extremely terrible actions are born in the hells, by the power of performing the rite in the proper way, they are freed from their sins and the results of the hells are great.

original: de'i thad kar 'bras bu chen po skyed de /
analyzed: de'i thad kar 'bras bu chen po skyed de /
translated: They generate a great result in that very place.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rdo rje gsang ba 'di lta bus //
analyzed: rdo rje gsang ba 'di lta bus //
translated: By this kind of vajra secret,

original: sems can thams cad bsad na ni //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsad na ni //
translated: if all sentient beings are killed,

original: mi bskyod rgyal ba'i zhing dag tu //
analyzed: mi bskyod rgyal ba'i zhing dag tu //
translated: in the pure realm of Akṣobhya

original: rgyal ba'i sras su skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes so // cho ga gang gis @199a * //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras su skye bar 'gyur // zhes so // cho ga gang gis @199a * //
translated: they are born as sons of the Victor.🔽In order to demonstrate the rite by which those deluded embodied beings are accomplished,

original: lus can rmongs pa de rnams bsgrub par bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus can rmongs pa de rnams bsgrub par bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: byang chub rdo rjes bsgrub bya 'di //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rjes bsgrub bya 'di //
translated: This is to be accomplished by Bodhivajra.

original: zhes te / sgrub pa pos bsgrub bya de sngags dang / thabs dang / sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyis rgyas btab cing sbyor ba des mchog tu phan btags par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes te / sgrub pa pos bsgrub bya de sngags dang / thabs dang / sbyor ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyis rgyas btab cing sbyor ba des mchog tu phan btags par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the adept should know that the object of attainment is sealed with the gnosis of nondual identity endowed with mantra, method, application, and so on, and that the object of attainment is benefited supremely by that application.

original: de ltar bsgrub byar gtogs pa'i cho ga bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub byar gtogs pa'i cho ga bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the rite belonging to the object of attainment,

original: da ni sgrub pa po'i yan lag kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sgrub pa po'i yan lag kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the limbs of the adept,

original: tshar gcod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshar gcod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “annihilation,” and so on.

original: de bas na lus can thams cad la phan btags par shes nas /
analyzed: de bas na lus can thams cad la phan btags par shes nas /
translated: Therefore, knowing that all embodied beings are benefited,

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas tshar gcad pa dang rjes su gzung ba'i las bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas tshar gcad pa dang rjes su gzung ba'i las bya'o zhes te /
translated: the yogī endowed with great compassion should perform the rites of annihilation and protection.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang gis snying rje ma nyams pa //
analyzed: gang gis snying rje ma nyams pa //
translated: He who does not lose compassion

original: de yis las 'di bya bar 'os //
analyzed: de yis las 'di bya bar 'os //
translated: is fit to perform this rite.

original: zhes so // sbyor ba gang gi dus su las 'di bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // sbyor ba gang gi dus su las 'di bya zhe na /
translated: At what time during the practice should this rite be performed?

original: sgrub pa po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares “the adept,” and so on.

original: de yang snying rje'i sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams te sbyor ba dang po'i mthar thug par byas nas dkyil 'khor dbyung ba nas /
analyzed: de yang snying rje'i sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams te sbyor ba dang po'i mthar thug par byas nas dkyil 'khor dbyung ba nas /
translated: Moreover, having generated the mind of compassion from the beginning up to the end of the first application, having drawn the mandala,

original: sgrub pa chen po'i mthar thug par byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rdzogs pas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gis las rnams bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po'i mthar thug par byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rdzogs pas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gis las rnams bsgrub par bya'o zhes so //
translated: having completed the wheel of the mandala up to the end of the great accomplishment, one should accomplish the actions by means of the supreme action of the Victor.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen po'i tshul gyis chos thos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis legs so ba'i tshig sngon du gsol nas ji skad gsungs pa'i don rjes su zlos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen po'i tshul gyis chos thos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis legs so ba'i tshig sngon du gsol nas ji skad gsungs pa'i don rjes su zlos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that having heard the Dharma by means of the method of the great compassion of the Tathagatas, the Bodhisattvas first utter the words of praise and then repeat the meaning of what was said,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so on.

original: sems can rnams g-yang sa las sgrol ba dang / nyon mongs pas non pa'i lus ngag gi las mi byed pa dang / phung po la sogs pa thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / yul tshad med pa bsgral bar dam bcas pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du mgon po dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams g-yang sa las sgrol ba dang / nyon mongs pas non pa'i lus ngag gi las mi byed pa dang / phung po la sogs pa thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / yul tshad med pa bsgral bar dam bcas pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du mgon po dang /
translated: And, the protector, the great sage, the great Dharma, and the great compassion are said in order to rescue sentient beings from the abyss, not to perform the actions of body and speech overwhelmed by afflictions, to purify all aggregates and so forth, and to rescue immeasurable objects.

original: thub pa chen po dang / chos rnams chen po dang / thugs rje chen po zhes gsol nas legs so zhes bya ba byin nas don de rjes su bzlas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: thub pa chen po dang / chos rnams chen po dang / thugs rje chen po zhes gsol nas legs so zhes bya ba byin nas don de rjes su bzlas pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus requested, Excellent! was given, and the meaning of that was repeated, saying:

original: ae ma'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Emaho! and so forth.

original: @199b kun du bzang po'i thugs rje ji lta bar dri ma med ce na /
analyzed: @199b kun du bzang po'i thugs rje ji lta bar dri ma med ce na /
translated: If it is asked, How is it stainless like the compassion of Samantabhadra?

original: gdug pa'i mi bzang las kyis kyang //
analyzed: gdug pa'i mi bzang las kyis kyang //
translated: It is said, Even by the karma of bad, fierce people, and so on.

original: zhes pa ni bla ma la smod pa la sogs pa bla ma 'ba' zhig gis grol ba'i sems can sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa las nyams shing phyir phyogs pa'i las can rnams sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu tshol zhes te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bla ma la smod pa la sogs pa bla ma 'ba' zhig gis grol ba'i sems can sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa las nyams shing phyir phyogs pa'i las can rnams sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu tshol zhes te /
translated: Those who have committed the karma of turning away from the doctrine of the Buddha, such as those who slander the guru, and so on, who are sentient beings to be liberated only by the guru, seek the result of buddhahood.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bshad pa'i cho ga phun sum tshogs pa'i nus pas gsol zhes so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i cho ga phun sum tshogs pa'i nus pas gsol zhes so //
translated: The power of the perfect ritual of explanation is called “recitation.”

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji bzhin pa'i don thugs su chud par mkhyen nas /
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji bzhin pa'i don thugs su chud par mkhyen nas /
translated: Now, the bodhisattvas, having understood the meaning as it is,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis don kho na la blo brtan por bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis don kho na la blo brtan por bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: the tathāgatas declare that the mind should be firmly fixed on the meaning alone.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: gsang ba 'dus par dbang bskur ba'i sngags ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la sogs pa las thams cad khyad par du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus par dbang bskur ba'i sngags ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la sogs pa las thams cad khyad par du gyur pa ste /
translated: The mantra of the empowerment in the Guhyasamāja is superior to all in the Yoga Tantra, etc.

original: de'i phyir de'i lung ji lta ba bzhin du thob pa'i sngags pas 'jigs par mi bya skrag par mi bya zhes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i lung ji lta ba bzhin du thob pa'i sngags pas 'jigs par mi bya skrag par mi bya zhes te /
translated: Therefore, the mantrin who has obtained the transmission of that should not be afraid, should not be frightened.

original: zhe sdang gi las la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi las la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is, of the actions of hatred, etc.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes zhus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes zhus pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The tathāgatas replied:

original: byang chub rdo rje las byung ba //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje las byung ba //
translated: “The bodhisattva has arisen from the vajra of enlightenment.”

original: zhes te / don dam par na rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo las byung zhing rnam par spros pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / don dam par na rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo las byung zhing rnam par spros pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: ultimately, the nature of Great Vajradhara is the source and the elaboration is Hatred Vajra and so forth.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sngags kyi rgyud ni bsdus pa dang // yongs su spang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyud ni bsdus pa dang // yongs su spang bar mi bya'o //
translated: the tantra of mantra is not to be rejected,

original: zhes te / zhe sdang gi las la sogs pa thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par dag pas na dor bar bya ba ji lta bu zhig yod de ;
analyzed: zhes te / zhe sdang gi las la sogs pa thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rnam par dag pas na dor bar bya ba ji lta bu zhig yod de ;
translated: since all the actions of hatred and so forth are pure by the very nature of Vajradhara. What is there to be rejected?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin kho na yin no zhes so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin kho na yin no zhes so //
translated: It is just the nature of what is to be accomplished.

original: da ni rgyud kyi don gyi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstod pa bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rgyud kyi don gyi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstod pa bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the praise by the bodhisattvas to the tathagatas from the perspective of the meaning of the tantra,

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then the bodhisattva” and so forth.

original: de la dus gsum rdo rje'i thugs yin ni /
analyzed: de la dus gsum rdo rje'i thugs yin ni /
translated: Therein, the three times are the mind of vajra.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas dag pa dang ma dag pa thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas dag pa dang ma dag pa thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the essence of all the pure and impure Buddhas of the past and future.

original: srid dang thar gyur zhes pa ni shes pa dang thugs rjes srid pa dang thar gyur te /🔽mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bdag nyid @200a * //
analyzed: srid dang thar gyur zhes pa ni shes pa dang thugs rjes srid pa dang thar gyur te / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bdag nyid @200a * //
translated: The phrase existence and liberation means that by knowledge and compassion, existence and liberation are attained.

original: can zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: can zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of having the nature of non-abiding nirvana is as follows.

original: zhi zhing sgrib med ces pa ni ro myang ba'i rgyun gyis zhi zhing shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa rnam par bsal ba ste /
analyzed: zhi zhing sgrib med ces pa ni ro myang ba'i rgyun gyis zhi zhing shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa rnam par bsal ba ste /
translated: The phrase peaceful and unobstructed means that by the stream of enjoyment, it is peaceful, and by the removal of the obstructions to omniscience, etc.

original: de'i phyir / nam mkha' dag pa'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir / nam mkha' dag pa'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: it is unobstructed. Therefore, it is said: The nature of pure space.

original: ces te / dmigs su med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes so ;
analyzed: ces te / dmigs su med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes so ;
translated: Since it is not an object of perception, it is like space.

original: / de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sangs rgyas la sogs zhes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs zhes te /
translated: It is said: The Buddha, etc.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yang sangs rgyas su 'gyur bas byang chub ste de nyid bdag po bas na dbang phyug rdo rje can no //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yang sangs rgyas su 'gyur bas byang chub ste de nyid bdag po bas na dbang phyug rdo rje can no //
translated: Since it is the enlightenment of the Buddhas, etc., who are eternal, etc., it is enlightenment. Since it is the lord, it is the lord Vajra.

original: de la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rtag tu ste blo dang mi 'byed pas phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
analyzed: de la lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rtag tu ste blo dang mi 'byed pas phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
translated: To that, I always bow down with body, speech, and mind, means that one should not separate the mind from that.

original: rnal 'byor pas kyang tha mi dad pa'i blos phyag bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas kyang tha mi dad pa'i blos phyag bya'o zhes so //
translated: The yogi should also bow down with a mind that is not different from that.

original: des ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: des ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa la bstod pa'o //
translated: That praises the perfection of one's own aim, the nature of the unelaborated Great Vajradhara.

original: da ni spros pa'i bdag nyid gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas lha thams cad kyi sgo nas bstod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni spros pa'i bdag nyid gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pas lha thams cad kyi sgo nas bstod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to praise the perfection of the aims of others, the nature of the elaborated [Vajradhara], he speaks from the perspective of all the deities.

original: gang zhig gzugs dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The praise is To you, the one with form, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis ni phung po lnga bstan la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis ni phung po lnga bstan la /
translated: Up to consciousness teaches the five aggregates.

original: de rnam par dag pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes so //
translated: The nature of Vairochana, who is the purification of those, and so on, is taught.

original: skye mched drug ni phyi'i skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug ni phyi'i skye mched drug ste /
translated: The six sense bases are the six external sense bases.

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes so //
translated: The nature of Rupavajra, and so on, is taught.

original: dbang po drug ces pa ni nang gi skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: dbang po drug ces pa ni nang gi skye mched drug ste /
translated: The six sense faculties are the six inner sense spheres,

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes so //
translated: and are of the nature of Kshitigarbha and so forth.

original: sa chu me rlung dang nam mkha' //
analyzed: sa chu me rlung dang nam mkha' //
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, and space,

original: zhes pa ni 'byung ba lnga bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'byung ba lnga bstan te /
translated: indicate the five elements,

original: spyan ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: and are of the nature of Lochana and so forth.

original: de thams cad kyang byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'dra ba nyid du rgya che zhing spros pa ste /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'dra ba nyid du rgya che zhing spros pa ste /
translated: All of them are like the vajra of the Thought of Enlightenment, and are extensive and elaborate.

original: de bas na de la yang gong ma'i tshul gyis bya ba rnam pa gsum gyis phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
analyzed: de bas na de la yang gong ma'i tshul gyis bya ba rnam pa gsum gyis phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
translated: Therefore, one should pay homage to them with the three modes as above.

original: de ltar chos can nyi shu rtsa gcig dag pa'i sgo nas bstod nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos can nyi shu rtsa gcig dag pa'i sgo nas bstod nas /
translated: Having thus praised the twenty-one bases of purification,

original: da ni nyon mongs pa gsum dag pa'i sgo nas sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsum la khyad par du bstod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni nyon mongs pa gsum dag pa'i sgo nas sku gsung thugs rdo rje gsum la khyad par du bstod pa gsungs pa /
translated: now he teaches the special praise of the three vajras of body, speech, and mind, from the point of view of the purification of the three poisons.

original: gti mug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Ignorance, etc.

original: de la gti mug rnam par dag pa ni sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de la gti mug rnam par dag pa ni sku rdo rje'o //
translated: There, the purification of ignorance is the vajra of body,

original: nyes pa ni zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni zhe sdang ste /
translated: fault is hatred,

original: de rnam par dag pa ni thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: Its purity is the mind vajra.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje chos bcas gang zhes te gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ni rdo rje chos bcas gang zhes te gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: The purity of passion is the vajra dharma, which is the speech vajra.

original: de'i sngon du song ba'i @200b rgyu ;
analyzed: de'i sngon du song ba'i @200b rgyu ;
translated: The cause that precedes that is

original: rig ma'i sbyor ba las byung rtag tu rab 'brel bar //
analyzed: rig ma'i sbyor ba las byung rtag tu rab 'brel bar //
translated: the cause that is always connected with the union with the knowledge consort.

original: zhes te / dus gang gi tshe de dang lhan cig tu 'dres pa des de'i tshe rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te / dus gang gi tshe de dang lhan cig tu 'dres pa des de'i tshe rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: At whatever time one is mixed with her, at that time there is purity.

original: de nas bzung ste rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dga' bas myos pa'i dngos por gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bzung ste rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dga' bas myos pa'i dngos por gyur pa ste /
translated: From that time on, one becomes an entity that is intoxicated by various kinds of joy.

original: srid pa ji srid kyi bar du ro myang ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'dra bar rgya chen por spros pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
analyzed: srid pa ji srid kyi bar du ro myang ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'dra bar rgya chen por spros pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
translated: One should pay homage to that vajra mind of Vajrasattva, which is like a vajra, which is the bliss of tasting it for as long as the world exists, and which is expanded to a great extent.

original: da ni rang bzhin dang sems su gtogs pa'i chos dag pa'i sgo nas khro bo rnams la bstod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin dang sems su gtogs pa'i chos dag pa'i sgo nas khro bo rnams la bstod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the praise of the wrathful ones is stated from the perspective of the purity of the phenomena that belong to the nature and mind,

original: dam par gzung dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam par gzung dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as “grasping the supreme” and so forth.

original: gzung pa ni spros pa'o ;
analyzed: gzung pa ni spros pa'o ;
translated: The apprehended is elaboration.

original: / dga' ba ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: / dga' ba ni sdud pa'o //
translated: Joy is the contracted.

original: rnam pa ni rang gi lha'i rnam par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni rang gi lha'i rnam par gyur pa'o //
translated: The aspect is the form of one's deity.

original: mi g-yo ba ni de nyid la brtan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni de nyid la brtan par gyur pa'o //
translated: Immovability is stability in that.

original: rgyu ni de nyid la slob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni de nyid la slob pa'o //
translated: The cause is training in that.

original: 'bras bu ni de nyid gsal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de nyid gsal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The result is the manifestation of that.

original: de rnams gong du smos pa'i rang bzhin las byung bas na rang bzhin du rjes su gtogs pa ni chos te /
analyzed: de rnams gong du smos pa'i rang bzhin las byung bas na rang bzhin du rjes su gtogs pa ni chos te /
translated: Since those arise from the nature mentioned above, the nature that is included is the Dharma.

original: don dang mtshan mar bcas pa rnam par dag pa khro bo drug go //
analyzed: don dang mtshan mar bcas pa rnam par dag pa khro bo drug go //
translated: The six wrathful ones are the purification of meaning and signs.

original: de bzhin du sems su gtogs pa'i chos ni gti mug dang nyes pa dang 'dod chags dang / sgrib pa rnams rnam par dag pas khro bo bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems su gtogs pa'i chos ni gti mug dang nyes pa dang 'dod chags dang / sgrib pa rnams rnam par dag pas khro bo bzhi ste /
translated: Similarly, the Dharma included in the mind is the four wrathful ones, which are the purification of delusion, faults, desire, and obscurations.

original: de thams cad kyang rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang rdo rje ste /
translated: All of those are vajras.

original: de bas na byang chub sems rdo rje 'dra bar rgya chen por spros pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems rdo rje 'dra bar rgya chen por spros pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the homage is to the extensive elaboration of the vajra-like bodhicitta.

original: de ltar lha'i ngo bo'i sgo nas bstod nas /
analyzed: de ltar lha'i ngo bo'i sgo nas bstod nas /
translated: Having praised the essence of the deity in that way,

original: da ni sgrub pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bstod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni sgrub pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas bstod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the praise by way of practice and so forth is stated.

original: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pas dang por gong gi don gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba dang ldan par bsgom pa de phyag 'tshal ba'i gnas yin par bstan te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pas dang por gong gi don gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba dang ldan par bsgom pa de phyag 'tshal ba'i gnas yin par bstan te /
translated: The first, beginning with whoever, teaches that the one who meditates endowed with the secret empowerment is the object of praise.

original: gang zhig ces pa ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: Whoever is the practitioner.

original: thog ma med dngos rnam dag 'di sgom pa //
analyzed: thog ma med dngos rnam dag 'di sgom pa //
translated: Meditates on this pure one without beginning

original: zhes pa ni dngos po'i tshogs thams cad thog ma med pa'i dus nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gong du gsungs pa ltar dag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dngos po'i tshogs thams cad thog ma med pa'i dus nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gong du gsungs pa ltar dag pa ste /
translated: means that the entire collection of entities is pure from beginningless time as the mandala circle explained above.

original: de yang thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i don nam mkha'i dkyil ltar rnam par dag pa las byung zhing mtshan ma'i spros pa dang bral ba sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i don nam mkha'i dkyil ltar rnam par dag pa las byung zhing mtshan ma'i spros pa dang bral ba sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, one meditates on the meaning of the inseparability of method and wisdom, which arises from the utterly pure space-like state free from the elaborations of signs.

original: gang dang ldan par sgom par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang dang ldan par sgom par byed ce na /
translated: With what is one endowed when one meditates?

original: gsang ba'i dbang thob nas khyad par gyi brtul zhugs dang dam tshig dang sbyor ba la gnas nas @201a * //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang thob nas khyad par gyi brtul zhugs dang dam tshig dang sbyor ba la gnas nas @201a * //
translated: Having obtained the secret empowerment, one abides in the special conduct, the commitments, and the yoga.

original: rtogs pa ni lam khyad par can dang ldan pas byang chub kyi sems rdo rje bzhin du bltas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni lam khyad par can dang ldan pas byang chub kyi sems rdo rje bzhin du bltas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
translated: Realization is the special path, and so one should pay homage to the one who is like the vajra of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: thabs kyi dngos po bzhis sgom par byed pa yang phyag 'tshal ba'i gnas yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: thabs kyi dngos po bzhis sgom par byed pa yang phyag 'tshal ba'i gnas yin par gsungs pa /
translated: Also, the one who meditates by means of the four things of method is said to be worthy of homage.

original: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the line beginning “whoever . . . ”

original: dngos grub mchog ni rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub mchog ni rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: The supreme power is Vajradhara.

original: de'i thabs ni ka la ste mda'i thabs dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i thabs ni ka la ste mda'i thabs dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The method for that is the ka, because it is like the method of an arrow.

original: de dngos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dngos gang zhe na /
translated: What is that thing?

original: bsnyen pa'i cho ga zhes bya ba ni sa lha'i sku'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i cho ga zhes bya ba ni sa lha'i sku'o //

original: nye bar sgrub pa ni mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar sgrub pa ni mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'o //

analyzed: sgrub pa ni sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlabs po'o //

analyzed: dngos grub chen po ni rigs kyi bdag pos dbu brgyan pa'o //

analyzed: de yang sngar bshad pa'i rim pa bzhin du phye ba rnams te /
translated: Moreover, these are the divisions according to the previously explained order.

analyzed: de la blo mi 'gyur ba'i sgrub pa'i dbang po de la yang byang chub rdo rje dang 'dra bar phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
translated: To him, the adept whose faculty is unchangeable, I pay homage, like Vajra of Enlightenment.

translated: The adept who meditates in four sessions is the object of homage by virtue of his meditative concentration.🔽This is taught by the verse beginning with “he who.

original: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning “Whatever” and so on.🔽

original: der sgrub par byed pa zhes so //
analyzed: der sgrub par byed pa zhes so //

original: des mi snang ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub nas mchog ste /
analyzed: des mi snang ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub nas mchog ste /
translated: By that, he attains the powers of invisibility and so forth, up to the supreme.

analyzed: de dag kho na smin pa'i dbang las sangs rgyas kyi dngos grub tu yang 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: From those very [powers], by the ripening of the initiation, he attains the power of Buddhahood.

analyzed: de lta bu'i bla ma'i drin gyis ma nor ba'i lam rtogs pa de la yang byang chub kyi sems rdo rje bzhin du phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //

translated: The homage to the one who is worthy of homage is taught by the statement that even those who listen to the Guhyasamaja Tantra, etc., attain the seed of Buddhahood.

original: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The homage to the one who is worthy of homage is taught by the statement that even those who listen

original: de yang le'u bcu bzhi pa la sogs pa las gsungs pa'i thabs dang / sngags dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyis de bzhin du rgyas btab pa'i sgrub pa'i dbang pos yang dag par zin pa'i bsgrub par bya ba 'di dang ldan pa de yang las kyi sgrib pa dang rnam par bral bas na byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'dra
analyzed: de yang le'u bcu bzhi pa la sogs pa las gsungs pa'i thabs dang / sngags dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyis de bzhin du rgyas btab pa'i sgrub pa'i dbang pos yang dag par zin pa'i bsgrub par bya ba 'di dang ldan pa de yang las kyi sgrib pa dang rnam par bral bas na byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'dra
translated: Moreover, by the means taught in the fourteenth chapter and so forth, and by the mantras and the rites of pacification and so forth, the adept who is sealed in that way, endowed with this practice, is also free from the obscurations of karma, and so one should see him as being like the vajra of the mind of enlightenment.

original: bar bltas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
analyzed: bar bltas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes so //
translated: I pay homage to him.

original: gang yang sgrub pa'i dbang po de lta bu mthong ba la sogs pas dga' ba yang dad pa'i stobs kyis mi dge ba'i las rnam par 'jig pas phyag 'tshal ba'i gnas yin par bstan pa /
analyzed: gang yang sgrub pa'i dbang po de lta bu mthong ba la sogs pas dga' ba yang dad pa'i stobs kyis mi dge ba'i las rnam par 'jig pas phyag 'tshal ba'i gnas yin par bstan pa /
translated: Moreover, the adept who is such is also the object of homage, because his seeing and so forth are joyful, and because his nonvirtuous karma is destroyed by the power of faith.

original: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is taught by “whoever,” and so forth.

original: gang zhig ces pa ni skye bo gang zhig ces pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa ni skye bo gang zhig ces pa'o //
translated: “Whoever” means “whatever person.”

original: gtso bo sgrub po zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa bla ma ste /
analyzed: gtso bo sgrub po zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa bla ma ste /
translated: “The principal adept” is the guru who abides in nondual yoga.

original: de gang zag gang gis mthong ba'am /
analyzed: de gang zag gang gis mthong ba'am /
translated: Whoever sees that, or touches it,

original: reg pa'am / yid la sems shing legs par dran par byed pa'am /
analyzed: reg pa'am / yid la sems shing legs par dran par byed pa'am /
translated: or thinks about it, or remembers it well,

original: ming tsam thos nas dad par byed cing yon tan gyi phyogs gcig tsam yang 'dzin par byed pa de yang bla ma'i stobs kyis dag pas na /
analyzed: ming tsam thos nas dad par byed cing yon tan gyi phyogs gcig tsam yang 'dzin par byed pa de yang bla ma'i stobs kyis dag pas na /
translated: or hears its name and has faith, or even just grasps one aspect of its qualities, will be purified by the power of the guru.

original: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'dra bar bltas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dang 'dra bar bltas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Therefore, I pay homage to the mind of enlightenment, which is like a vajra.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:🔽Whoever sees it,

original: gang zhig mthong bar gyur pa dang // thams cad du ni mchod gyur na //
analyzed: gang zhig mthong bar gyur pa dang // thams cad du ni mchod gyur na //
translated: and worships it everywhere,🔽will see all the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba dang // mchod pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba dang // mchod pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin //
translated: and will make offerings to them.

original: zhes so // de ltar tshigs su bcad pa bcus bstod pa'i sgo nas rgyud kyi don rjes su bstan nas da ni don chen pos bstod pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir bstod pa'i tshig ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar tshigs su bcad pa bcus bstod pa'i sgo nas rgyud kyi don rjes su bstan nas da ni don chen pos bstod pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir bstod pa'i tshig ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, having taught the meaning of the tantra by way of the ten verses of praise, now, in order to teach the benefits of the praise of the great meaning, [the Bhagavān] declares “the words of praise,” and so on.

original: bstod pa'i tshig ni zhi ba 'dis //
analyzed: bstod pa'i tshig ni zhi ba 'dis //
translated: By these words of praise, which are peaceful,

original: zhes pa ni don zhi bar rab tu ston pa'i phyir de skad do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don zhi bar rab tu ston pa'i phyir de skad do //
translated: This is so because it teaches the meaning of peace.

original: 'dren pa kun zhes pa ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'dren pa kun zhes pa ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams te /
translated: All the guides are the Sugatas,

original: thugs rje'i phyag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽de rnams bstod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' grags chen la //
analyzed: thugs rje'i phyag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // de rnams bstod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' grags chen la //
translated: because they have the hand of compassion.

original: mgon po de dag ces te /
analyzed: mgon po de dag ces te /
translated: Those lords rejoice in the praise of those great famous Bodhisattvas,

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams yi rang zhing mngon par dga'o zhes so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams yi rang zhing mngon par dga'o zhes so //
translated: and they rejoice in the praise of the future yogis.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bstod pa 'di byas na de dag dga' zhing dngos grub stsol bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i @202a * //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bstod pa 'di byas na de dag dga' zhing dngos grub stsol bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i @202a * //
translated: The meaning is that if those future yogis make this praise, they will be pleased and grant the powers.

original: don to ; / da ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di ni rgyud gzhan las phul du byung bar bstan pa'i phyir 'dus pa gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don to ; / da ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud 'di ni rgyud gzhan las phul du byung bar bstan pa'i phyir 'dus pa gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to show that this Guhyasamaja Tantra is superior to other Tantras, [the Bhagavat] declares the Guhyasamaja, etc.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi don 'dir 'dus pas na kun gyi bdag po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi don 'dir 'dus pas na kun gyi bdag po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the lord of all because the meaning of all Tantras is contained herein.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na rgyud 'di legs par gsungs pa yin zhes te sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa gnyis dang bral bar gsungs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na rgyud 'di legs par gsungs pa yin zhes te sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa gnyis dang bral bar gsungs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this tantra is well-spoken, meaning that it is taught free from the two, superimposition and deprecation.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad ji skad bshad pa'i de kho na nyid kyi don la sbyar nas cang mi gsung bar sbyar ba bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces bka' stsal nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa thams cad ji skad bshad pa'i de kho na nyid kyi don la sbyar nas cang mi gsung bar sbyar ba bstan pa'i phyir de skad ces bka' stsal nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to show that all of the Tathagatas and so forth were silent after being applied to the meaning of reality as it has been explained, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Having spoken thus,” and so forth.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /🔽sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku rdo rje la sogs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs la zhes te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste / sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku rdo rje la sogs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs la zhes te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: sa bon gyis bsdus nas rnam par bcug ste sku la sogs pa yang de bzhin nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra bar brjod du med pas na de la dmigs te cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon gyis bsdus nas rnam par bcug ste sku la sogs pa yang de bzhin nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra bar brjod du med pas na de la dmigs te cang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The “vajra of body, speech, and mind” is the vajra-holder’s vajra body and so forth. “All of the Tathagatas’ bodies, speech, and minds” are included in the seed [syllables]. Having inserted them, [the Bhagavān] spoke of the body and so forth as being reality, which is like space and inexpressible. Therefore, having focused on that, [the Bhagavān] became silent.

original: de bas na 'di ni dkyil 'khor bsdu ba'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni dkyil 'khor bsdu ba'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be seen as the meaning of the dissolution of the mandala.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni sku dang gsung dang thugs te de'i ngo bo nyid ni gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni sku dang gsung dang thugs te de'i ngo bo nyid ni gsang ba'o //
translated: The nature of all the Tathagatas is body, speech, and mind, and their essence is the secret.🔽Therefore, the secret is also that assembly, and thus the tantra is called the Guhyasamaja Tantra, because it reveals all the secrets, the hidden essences.

original: de bas na gsang ba yang de 'dus pa yang de bas na gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las gsang ba thams cad de sbas pa'i ngo bo rnams ston pas na des byin gyis brlab cing shes par byed pa dang / mdzes pa'i don gyi rgyal po ste de ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi le'u bco brgyad pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bas na gsang ba yang de 'dus pa yang de bas na gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud las gsang ba thams cad de sbas pa'i ngo bo rnams ston pas na des byin gyis brlab cing shes par byed pa dang / mdzes pa'i don gyi rgyal po ste de ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi le'u bco brgyad pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is the king of beautiful meanings, and the text that reveals it is the eighteen chapters.

original: gang zhig gsang rgyud yang dag sbas pa rnams sbyin pa //
analyzed: gang zhig gsang rgyud yang dag sbas pa rnams sbyin pa //
translated: He who bestows the secret tantra, the true hidden secrets,

original: bde gshegs blo mchog nyi ma'i 'od 'dra phyi ma'i rgyud //
analyzed: bde gshegs blo mchog nyi ma'i 'od 'dra phyi ma'i rgyud //
translated: The later tantra, the supreme light of the Sugata's mind,

original: tha shal bdag 'dras ga la stobs te gzhag par 'os //
analyzed: tha shal bdag 'dras ga la stobs te gzhag par 'os //
translated: How could one like me, the lowest, have the power to explain it? It is fitting to leave it as it is.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' la phan pa dam pa'i bka' yis de ni phye //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' la phan pa dam pa'i bka' yis de ni phye //
translated: Nevertheless, for the benefit of some, it is opened by the sacred words.

original: de las byung ba'i dge ba kha ba zla ba ltar snang bas //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i dge ba kha ba zla ba ltar snang bas //
translated: The virtue that arises from that shines like snow and the moon.

original: skye bo gsang ba 'dus rgyud yang dag don ni rab chud de //
analyzed: skye bo gsang ba 'dus rgyud yang dag don ni rab chud de //
translated: May beings fully understand the true meaning of the Guhyasamāja Tantra.

original: 'di lam rim pa gang gis 'gro ba'i lam de yis //
analyzed: 'di lam rim pa gang gis 'gro ba'i lam de yis //
translated: By the path on which they proceed,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa la yang dag rol bar shog /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa la yang dag rol bar shog /
translated: may they perfectly enjoy the stage of the vajra holder.

original: yang dag rig byed ces bya ba rgyud phyi ma'i rnam par bshad pa slob dpon bee dya p'a das mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: yang dag rig byed ces bya ba rgyud phyi ma'i rnam par bshad pa slob dpon bee dya p'a das mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the continuation of the tantra called the True Knowledge is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ka ma la gu hya dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba mnga' bdag lha ye shes rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur cing zhus pa'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ka ma la gu hya dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba mnga' bdag lha ye shes rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur cing zhus pa'o /
translated: The Indian preceptor Kamalaghīya and the Tibetan translator, the lord Yeshé Gyeltsen, translated and revised this.
